credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Bronze.  Rectangular with plain narrow border.  Three horses in low relief facing right.  Knob on top and pierced hole in each corner.  Five other holes accidental? Lower right corner missing.  Green patina. Much worn.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Fish suspended from plaque with four pierced holes. One loop damaged. Scales indicated by hatching, both sides alike.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Harness Ornament
description: Brass. Openwork showing griffin with single head and two bodies. Two studs on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Pin Head
description: Bronze. Tiger rampant.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Gilt rectangular with deeply concave sides.  Decorated with four bird's heads.  Four pierced holes.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Printing Block
description: Wooden strip with handle on one end, carved on one side with calligraphic relief for printing. "617" in faint red written in reverse. Note found with it indicates it is "From Sutra of Wisdom...for long life and happiness."
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Printing Block
description: Square wooden board with handle on one edge and carved decorative relief for printing on one side. Roughly hexagonal carved design incorporates a six pointed star and Tibetan writing.  The text is a prayer to protect the owner from a hail storm.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Bell
description: Bronze.  Spherical. Made in two parts. Seven holes; loop on top. Pebble inside.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Brass. Rectangular openwork. Two deer grazing under trees. Three prongs on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Same as 41-37-38.  Top horse missing.  Smooth dark green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Same as 41-37-38 but still cruder.  Dark green water patina.  Very worn.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Similar to 41-37-129 but bird has shorter neck.  Dark green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Crested bird. Body and tail hatched to show feathers.  Suspended by loop on top.  Only patinated partly.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Roughly rectangular. Spiral design, possibly bird-head derivative. Central boss. Loop broken. Green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Stag running with legs bent under body, head thrust out. Both sides the same.  Head and horns pierced with iron nail (?) in one piercing.  (damage)
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Two conventionalized birds' heads on one side of central boss. Deeply cut. Single loop. Three pierced holes.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ring
description: Bronze. Possibly an earring. Griffin head decoration in relief on one side. Smooth black patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Similar to 41-37-22 except for division into two panels.  Animals are represented thinner, allowing more openwork, ears perforated.  Reverse smooth, giving impression that this piece was cut or hammered, the other cast.  Traces of green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Brass. Conventionalized scroll pattern possibly bird head derivative. Central boss. Somewhat similar to 41-37-185 with silver wash. Red incrustation.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Big horned sheep suckling young.  Traces of red and green patina.  Pitted surface.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Big horned sheep.  Dark green surface, red incrustation.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Harness Ornament
description: Bronze. Circular openwork showing small duck resting on lily pad surrounded by aquatic leaves. Both sides the same. Similar to 41-37-413. Very much worn.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Bronze. Slightly convex pierced discs.  Each with coiled onager.  Border of small onager heads in profile.  Two loops on reverse of each, (three broken). Entire surface convered with rough green patina and red incrustations.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Bronze. Slightly convex pierced discs.  Each with coiled onager.  Border of small onager heads in profile.  Two loops on reverse of each, (three broken). Entire surface convered with rough green patina and red incrustations.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  square with high circular boss. Crouching figure of bear (?). Green patina and traces of gilt.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Bronze. Circular boss showoing figure of couching boar. Ears pierced. One loop on reverse.  Dark smooth patina. One hole near head.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Handle (uncertain)
description: Bronze.  Lynx head on long grooved handle.  Use unknown, possibly key to a lock. Smooth dark surface.  Hole and crack at end of handle.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Harness Bell
description: Bronze.  Dome-shaped, no clapper. Green patina. Two perforations at base.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Stag, position similar to 41-37-57.  Damaged in body.  Loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Hat
description: "Yellow Lama's Ceremonial Hat."  Brown velvet, bound with red cotton and with two small red cotton tabs with blue inset at back. Entire upper edged overcast with yellow wool thread terminating in tangled fringe. Chanting hat.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Bell
description: Bronze. Triangular, undecorated. Attachment pierced for suspension. No clapper.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Bell
description: Bronze. Truncated cone with fore four long rectangular openings. Engraved design of birds on solid base. Attachment pierced for suspending. No clapper.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Buckle
description: Bronze. Fore-quarters of crouching lion in front of rectangular loop.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Same as 41-37-40.  Forelock has pierced hole.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Dog, legs bent under body, paws meeting.  Both sides finished. Bright green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Knife
description: Brass. Very slightly curved. Top has two joined long-beaked birds' heads indented for inlay on each side. Plain handle. Traces of green patina. Point of blade broken.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Frog in the round, two studs under mouth.  Pellet eyes.  Green patina with incrustations.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Stag standing erect. Dark water patina, two pierced holes for attachment.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Bronze. Openwork with border and rounded corners.  Two horses, a small one standing on top of a larger one.  Forelock tied to look like a pompon.  Border broken in one corner.  Dull patina.  See also 41-37-36 through 39.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Bronze. Pierced disc with one flat edge. Coiled tiger.  Paw pierced. Single loop on reverse.  Green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Figurine
description: Similar to 41-37-101. Brass. Hollow. Boar with long snout; suspended by loop above rope-like attachment.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Buckle
description: Same as 41-37-436. Bronze.Relief design of duck rising from water and aquatic plants.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Belt Hook
description: Bronze.  Rabbit with large stud on reverse and hook projecting from rabbit's head. Hook bent.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Axe Head
description: Bronze. Hollow, wedge-shaped, undecorated.  Two irregular communicating holes. Mottled greenish water patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Brid derivative. Boss in center; deeply carved, much worn.  Single loop.  In shape of two joined three-lobed discs.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Two deeply cut spiral scrolls, possibly bird head derivative. Single loop. Green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Similar to one panel of 41-37-26.  Rope-like border. Smooth dark surface, earth incrustations.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Boar, upright curling tail. Loop on reverse. Dark water patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Brass. Circular boss.  Border of small bird head, eyes pierced, beaks indented for inlay.  Very conventionalized. Center damaged. Single loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Double scroll of two stylized, curled, horned animals (dragon ?) with heads diagonally opposed. Two circular depresseions (one broken through) for inlay.  Dot decoration around body (scales?). Brown patina. Bent loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Two-lobed conventionalized pattern (bird derivative).  Central boss. Deeply cut. Single loop on reverse. Green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Buckle
description: Bronze. Circular with broken loop. Coiling serpent in relief. Loop on reverse formed by two strips set together.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Rain Coat
description: Made of woven coir palm. In two pieces, consisting of a cape (A) and skirt (B).
credit_line: Gift of Rev. Robert J. Bolton, 1985

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Roughly rectangular, contracted in center. Spiral design, possibly bird-head derivative. Rough green patina and incrustation. One loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Garment
description: Nearly square piece of cotton cloth with seam down middle. Natural with red and blue imbricated technique. Worn hung from shoulder of woman.
credit_line: Gift of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 1997

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Central boss with conventionalized bird head at each corner. Single loop. Indented for inlay; four pierced holes. Dark brown patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Harness Bell
description: Bronze.  Dome-shaped, no clapper. Green patina. Four perforations at base.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Belt Hook
description: Bronze.  Elephant head with horn-like ears and long trunk that stretches out to form hook.  Tip of trunk missing.  Chinese characters scratched on stud. Traces of reddish pigment.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Tile Fragment
description: Terminal Fragment.  Yellow. Five-clawed Imperial dragon of Late Ming type.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Harness Ornament
description: Bronze. Circular with rectangular projecting loop. Two-headed hydra coiled around, heads meeting at base, both sides similar. Smooth red patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Pair of rabbits, one above the other. Tails in form of small rabbit heads. Uncommon type. Green patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Brass (?). Rabbit in the round. Vertical piercing through body.  Used on cord like Japanese ojime (?)
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Head of fox, damaged, very long snout.  Eyes pierced, ears deeply indented.  Dark patina with red incrustations.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Harness Bell
description: Brass.  Dome-shaped, no clapper. Two perforations at base.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Hydra with tail coiled over head resting on upper edge of plain boss. Reverse has single loop on boss. Hole worn through. Rough, rusty, red and green patina. Probably has ben through fire.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Conventionalized, elongated bird. One loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Printing Block
description: Wooden strip with hole on one end and carved relief for printing on one side. Carved rectilinear form encloses a short inscription and one border is embellished with scallops.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Openwork; subrectangular. Two griffins fighting in the center. Used to hold straps in place. Similar objects used by Mongolians at present time.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Buckle Fragment
description: Bronze.  Monkey leaning on bench. Broken. One pierced hole. Stud on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Belt Hook
description: Bronze.  Tiger stretched out on paws with elongated tail forming the hook. Stud under shoulders.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Fish suspended from plaque with four pierced holes. Scales indicated by hatching, both sides alike.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Brass. Fore part of two tigers, one end lying flat ready to pounce, other end with head turned and seen in profile. Loop on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Pot
description: Reretan. Biconical jar with flaring rim and round base. Snake and sun pattern decoration. Traditionally used as bridewealth among upper class and treated as heirlooms. This pot was made as part of the revival of the aboriginal pottery industry by Saguliu of the Pavavalong family in Parilaiyan, a northern Paiwan village.
credit_line: Gift of Bien D. Chang, 1988

title: Shirt
description: Heavy cotton cloth. Natural color and brown. Imbricated technique. Seam on both sides and middle of back, front left open. Worn by men.
credit_line: Gift of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 1997

title: Ornament
description: Silver (?).  Bird Derivative. Deeply cut.  Orignally inlayed (?). Single loop. Bright silvery surface.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Button
description: Bronze. Similar to 41-37-141. Slightly convex disc, coiled fox. Details of head and paws shown by indented circles. Cruder and badly worn.  Bright green patina, dark incrustation.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Handle (uncertain)
description: Bronze. Long curved rod with hydra head at one end and leaf-shapd point flanked by two argali heads at the other. Probably late Scythian or Sino-Scythian.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Brass. Figure of sleeping dog, front paws stretched out and crossed, ornament about neck. Three prongs on reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Hat
description: Fur cap, sable colored.
credit_line: Purchased from Robert Zingg, 1945

title: Coin (uncertain)
description: Lead. Wrapped in white linen.
credit_line: The Eckley B. Coxe Jr. Expedition to Mit-Rahineh (Memphis), Egypt, 1915-1920

title: Coin (uncertain)
description: Lead. Wrapped in white linen.
credit_line: The Eckley B. Coxe Jr. Expedition to Mit-Rahineh (Memphis), Egypt, 1915-1920

title: Knife
description: Butt end missing. Pseudomorphs after matting. Fiber shapes can be seen where matting has been removed.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Knife Fragment
description: Butt end. Remains of matting sheath.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Relic Box
description: Brass relic box. The inscription on the front of this box is the Sanskrit syllable 'Om', a sacred sound used for meditation.
credit_line: Purchased from Alexander Scott, 1914

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Standing stag with head erect and thrown back, decorated surface.  One foreleg missing.  Both sides similar.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze openwork of two horses, foreleg and tail of the larger one bent to form border.  Smaller standing on back of larger.  Both have topknot.  Two loops on back.  Dark reddish patina.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Openwork of single trotting horse. Black water patina, traces of gilt. Much worn.  Reverse smooth.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Buckle
description: Bronze.  Two parts each with a rectangular lop on one side.  The larger part consists of a circular disc.  The outer sections of which is ornamented with a floral design.  The depressed inner section has a wide horizontal slot into which the slightly convex disc (also ornamented with flower design) of the other part fits.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze.  Standing horse.  Flat crude workmanship. One foreleg broken off, one bend.  Green patina.  Traces of gilt.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Running stag, with long curving horns, large round eye.  Body and legs decorated with ridges.  Green patina.  Traces of gilt.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Stag with long convetionalized horns, head thrown back, forefoot under body, hindfoot extended forward into loop attachment.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Ornament
description: Bronze. Tiger on two fixed rings.  Ornamented body. Loop on reverse. Traces of gilt.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Brass. Rectangular openwork with narrow plain border.  Three horses one above the other. Center one facing left, others right.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Printing Block
description: Wooden strip with handle on one end, carved on one side with calligraphic relief for printing.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Printing Block
description: Wooden strip with handle on one end, carved reflief of calligraphy on one side for printing. "618" in faint red written on bottom side. Note indicates piece is a "prayer to the gate of wisdom, the perfection of merit, and the perfection of power."
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Belt Hook
description: Bronze. Shape similar to 41-37-316. Owl-like head above the stud. Hook plain.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Plaque
description: Silvered bronze.  Openwork, slightly convex, composed of three floral medallions with rope border.  Traces of red and green patina.  One crack and break in center.
credit_line: Purchased from William Mayer, 1941

title: Jar Lid
description: Lid (C312B) for jar(C312A).
credit_line: Purchased from Duveen Brothers, 1917

title: Game Diagram
description: Paper game board.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Clog
description: One of a pair of platform clogs.  Worn by girls.  Leather tops.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Clog
description: One of a pair of platform clogs.  Worn by girls.  Leather tops.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Figurine

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. Blurry and undecipherable.

title: China Fragments
provenience: United States of America | Alaska | Diyaguna'Et | Yakutat Bay | Lost River
description: 6 pieces of china 4 pieces of copper 1 iron belt 2 metal loops

title: Compass
description: Luopan (羅盤). Chinese compass and dial.
credit_line: Gift of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 1997

title: Disc

description: No Inscription

description: One of two dice cups.  European form ivory, red.

title: Game
description: Wooden box for holding game pieces.  Square.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Ruler

title: Coin
description: Obv. 利用通寶 Li Yong Tong Bao. Rev. Plain. 1674 - 1678 CE. Minted by Wu Sangui (吳三桂) a military rebel who set up his own short lived Dynasty (大周 Great Zhou). The Qing court coferred on him the title Ping Xi Wang (平西王) "Pacifying the West King" after defeating Ming armies in southwest China.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

description: Obv. 昭武通寶 Zhao Wu Tong Bao. Rev. Plain. 1678 CE. Minted by Wu Sangui (吳三桂) a military rebel who set up his own short lived Dynasty (大周 Great Zhou). The Qing court conferred on him the title Ping Xi Wang (平西王) "Pacifying the West King" after defeating Ming armies in southwest China.

title: Coin
description: Obv. 利用通寶 Li Yong Tong Bao. Rev. 貴 Gui above. Guizhou mint. 1674 - 1678 CE. Minted by Wu Sangui (吳三桂) a military rebel who set up his own short lived Dynasty (大周 Great Zhou). The Qing court conferred on him the title Ping Xi Wang (平西王) "Pacifying the West King" after defeating Ming armies in southwest China.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 利用通寶 Li Yong Tong Bao. Rev. 二厘Er li (2 li [of silver]) right and left. 2 cash coin. 1674 - 1678 CE. Minted by Wu Sangui (吳三桂) a military rebel who set up his own short lived Dynasty (大周 Great Zhou). The Qing court conferred on him the title Ping Xi Wang (平西王) "Pacifying the West King" after defeating Ming armies in southwest China.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 利用通寶 Li Yong Tong Bao. Rev. 雲 Yun right. Yunnan-fu mint. 1674 - 1678 CE. Minted by Wu Sangui (吳三桂) a military rebel who set up his own short lived Dynasty (大周 Great Zhou). The Qing court conferred on him the title Ping Xi Wang (平西王) "Pacifying the West King" after defeating Ming armies in southwest China.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 弘光通寶 Hong Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Dot above.  Prince of Fu (福王). Hongguang Emperor.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 宅陽 Zhai Yang (?). Rev. Plain. State: Han 韓.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 高都 Gao Du (Inscription Reversed). Rev. Plain. State: Liang 梁.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 至大元寶 Zhi Da Yuan Bao. Rev. Plain. 1310 - 1311 CE. Regular coin, 1 cash size.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Round handled, round shoulder, round foot spade coin. Obv. 焛(藺) Lin.  Rev. 一 Yi (One).
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 八邑 Ba Yi or 分邑 Feng Yi. Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo joo left and right. 三 San (three) above. Mint: Unknown. Largely illegible.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, arched foot spade coin. Obv. 麌半釿  Yu Ban Jin (Yu half jin). Rev. Plain. Rare.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 康熙通寶 Kang Xi Tong Bao. Rev. Yun left, 雲 Yun right. Mint: Yunnan province. 1667 - 1670 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. Lin 焛 or (藺). Rev. Plain. State: Zhao 趙.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 王氏 Wang Shi. Wang clan of Southern Shanxi. Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 至正通寶 Zhi Zheng tong bao. Rev. ꡖꡞRhi for Er above. 二 Er (2) below. From 1350 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Bowl
description: Flat base, convex sides. Buff ware. Splash glaze-- green and brown; compare colors with those on glazed horses and camels. Two characters written on side.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Sash
description: Sash, reverse design; Chinese characters and geometric in blue, white and pulled fringe in center and ends.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Sash
description: Sash, reverse design; Chinese characters and geometric; purple, mauve, green, yellow, with pulled fringe in center and ends.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Skirt Fragment
description: Faded embroidered silk skirt fragment. Pink embroidered panel and six areas of embroidered flowers. Banding at edges of blue embroidery on black silk.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Guy H. Dorsey, 1985

title: Medicine Jar
description: Medicine jar.  Small round (cylindrical) greenish blue pot - with Chinese label on top.  Had been sealed with serise paper. Label reads: [  ] 滋堂  參貝陳皮
credit_line: Deposited by R. Stewart Culin, 1890

title: Mirror
description: Bronze mirror. Typical Huai style with a "feather and leaf" design with "four T" motifs.  It has a fine smooth green patina. It came with a fitted box.
credit_line: Purchased from Mathias Komor, 1954

title: Coin
description: Obv. 康熙通寶 Kang Xi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Mint: The Board of Revenue. 1662 - 1683 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 唐國通寶 Tang Guo Tong Bao (Tang Kingdom currency). Seal script. Rev. Large dot above.  From 959 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Boo shan left and right. Mint: Xi'an, Shaanxi. Local type. 1754 - 1784 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Mint: The Board of Revenue. 1887 - 1898 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo he left and right. Crescent above. Mint: Kaifeng, Henan. 1898 - 1905 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo guang left and right. Mint: Guangzhou, Guangdong. 1890 - 1895 CE. Struck coin.

credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Scales
description: Rectangular brass weight with square projection to be used to tie weight to rod of scale. Still has thread attached to one end.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Adze
description: "L"- shaped brass adze. Bottom edge has been filed to a blade for cutting. Upright handle has small curvy design carved into it.

description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo jiyen left and right. Small line below. Mint: Tianjin, Zhili. 1886 - 1888 CE.

title: Charm
description: Obv. 天子萬年 Tian Zi Wan Nian ([May the Emperor] Son of Heaven [live for] a myriad [10,000] of years). Rev. Dragon and phoenix
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 洪武通寶 Hong Wu Tong Bao. Rev. 十福 Shi Fu above and below. Fujian mint. 10 cash. 1368 - 1398 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Ornament
description: A nephrite jade pi (bi) of a blunt nosed dragon. The carving is crude and the stone is a grey color.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo jiyen left and right. Crescent below. Mint: Tianjin, Zhili. 1886 - 1888 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 平陽 Ping Yang. Rev. Plain. State: Liang 梁 or Zhao 趙.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. ꡈꡗ ꡝꡧꡦꡋ ꡉꡟꡃ ꡎꡓTa Uen Tung Baw (Chinese: 大元通寶 Da Yuan Tong Bao). Inscription in Phagspa script. Rev. Plain. 1310 - 1311 CE. 10 cash coin.
credit_line: Gift of Shirley J. Cohen, 2010

title: Spade Coin
description: Hollow handled, square shoulder, spade money. Obv. 留 Liu (Liu city. State of Song, North Jiangsu). Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Hollow handled, square shoulder, spade money. Obv. 智 Zhi (Zhi city. State of Jin. Southwest Shanxi). Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Pedestal Bowl
description: Pedestal bowl.  Shallow bowl with slightly inset side:  hollow, flaring foot with ridge near its top.  Reddish brown ware.  Some details painted red.  Typical han decoration.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Figurine
description: Figure seated on a plinth. Apple green robe decorated with black (yellow?) dragon which is surrounded by clouds in aubergine; the arm out is porcelain. Condition (1914) perfect.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Skirt Fragment
description: Faded embroidered yellow silk.  Panel and vertical rows of embroidered flowers.  Bands of blue embroidered edging on black silk around panel and along bottom.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Guy H. Dorsey, 1985

title: Pants
description: A pair of narrow black cotton leggings attached in a pants-like fashion with a wasit band ending in ties.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Cap
description: Blue velvet cap with square embroidered applique at top. Four grommet holes at each of the square's four points. Blue cotton interior. Two halves were sewn together and were once poorly resewn.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Sleeve Vase
description: Simple porcelain sleeve vase with blue underglaze design of petals and blades (base), Two court ladies with flowered plants in between and chrysanthemums. Glazed base, with Yu (玉) mark.
credit_line: Gift of Irving B. Wexlar, 1981

title: Bowl
description: Interior with side famille rose floral and gilt border. Six side panels with alternating figural and floral designs inside and outside. Six corresponding panels on center circle. Unglazed footrim. Unsigned.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Jar Lid
description: Jar lid.  Light colored stoneware with cream colored glaze.  "Pie crust" decoration molded band.  Pointed knob.  See 87-33-2A for jar.  Cracked and repaired.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard C. Bull, 1987

title: Mouth Organ
description: Sheng. Used in temple orchestration. Dark wood with ivory on mouthpiece, tips of pipes, and on bottom of pipe holder. Seventeen pipes. Poor condition. All pipes detached, tips broken.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo jiyen left and right. Sideways crescent above right. Mint: Tianjin, Zhili. 1886 - 1888 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A white nephrite (a) bottle in the shape of a frog. Well shaped. The eyes are of green jadeite and the stopper (b) is coral.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo left, right character is illegible. Possibly jin. Mint: Taiyuan, Shanxi. 1865 or 1873 - 1874 CE.

description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo jiyen left and right. Small circle above left. Mint: Tianjin, Zhili. 1886 - 1888 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo yun left and right. 十 Shi above 一 Yi below. Mint: Yunnan province. Largely illegible.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, square-foot spade coin. Obv. 皮氏 Pi Shi. Rev. Plain. Pi clan of W.W. Shanxi. State: Liang 梁.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Sloping shouldered, arched-bottom, hollow socket, spade coin. Obv. 盧氏 Lu Shi or 慮化 Lu Hua. Rev. Plain. State: Han 韓.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 五銖 Wu Zhu (five grain) vertical line below. Rev. Plain. There is a circular hole in top of the coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, pointed foot spade coin. Obv. 焛(藺)?半 Lin Ban (Lin half [jin]. Ban on left. Rev. Plain. Unusual.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, arched foot spade money. Obv. 言易一釿 Yan Yi Yi Jin (Yanyi one jin). Rev. Plain. Inverted. Possibly fake.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 北洋造 (Made in Pei Yang)  光緒元寶 (Guangxu Coinage) 库平七錢二分 (7 Mace 2 Candareens).  Rev. 34th YEAR OF KUANG HSU PEI YANG with Dragon. Denomination: 1 dollar. 1908 CE.
credit_line: Gift of Shirley J. Cohen, 2010

title: Bowl
description: Ring base, rounded sides. Once had metal rim. Qingbai ware. Thick white glaze on both surfaces. Feather design incised under glaze in center interior. Two characters written on bottom.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Drum
description: Chan-ku. Wood with two skin heads attached by large nails. Three metal rings. Rattling agent inside. Should have stand (attached to A856). Wood cracked, hole in one head.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Portrait
description: Portrait of female (possibly empress or aristocratic lady) seated on black chair; wearing red, blue, green and gold clothing; gold and red crown with dangling white beads; white background and floral pattern on bottom.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1966

title: Garment Fragment
description: Green silk embroidered with a floral pattern. Band of green and pink ribbon and band of blue embroidered edging on black silk. Possibly part of a sleeve?
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Guy H. Dorsey, 1985

title: Dish
description: Small white glazed dish with blue designs. In blue on the inside of the dish there are concentric circles and curly lines. Raised foot rim.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Bowl
description: Large ring base with narrow flat base; short, rounded sides; rolled rim. Dark brown glaze interior and most of exterior; cf. glaze on 49-14-28. Jian ware.
credit_line: Bequest of Julia Morgan through brother Hugh Morgan, 1949

title: Skirt Fragment
description: Faded embroidered green silk skirt. Embroidered vertical rows of flowers with band of pink and green ribbon and band of blue embroidered edging on black silk.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Guy H. Dorsey, 1985

title: Skirt Fragment
description: Green embroidered silk with embroidered panel and vertical rows of embroidered flowers. Bands of pink and green ribbon and band of blue embroidered edging on black silk.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Guy H. Dorsey, 1985

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo yun left and right. 六 (?) Liu (six) above. Mint: Yunnan province. Unclear if the 六 is sideways?
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Amulet
description: Obv. 前山風雨涼, 歇馬坐垂楊. 何處芙蓉落, 南渠秋水香 辛卯年. Rev. Flower. A poem to a departing friend from the Tang Dynasty by Xu Hun 许浑 (ca. 791 - ca. 858 CE).
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. Boo yun left and right. Mint: Yunnan province. Local  type. 1851 - 1854 CE.The Manchu on the reverse is blurred but may be Boo yun.
