credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing Daoist figure wearing a long rove, hands clasped in front and hidden by sleeves. Double peaked headgear with badge.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a civilian.  Slate grey clay.  Body dipped in red clay.  C217 and C218 are a pair.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing Daoist figure, identical to 80-5-20. A heavy sash is wrapped around the body, over sleeves and hands.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Charm
description: Obv. 大泉五十 Da Quan Wu Shi (Large coin fifty). Rev. Tortoise, snake, seven-star big dipper, and sword.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 五行大布 Wu Xing Da Bu (The Large oin of the Five Elements). Rev. Snake, sword, tortoise, big dipper.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statue Base
description: Lotus pedestal or base for a bronze figure of Amitabha.
credit_line: Purchased from C. T. Loo; Subscription of A. Felix du Pont, 1938

title: Charm
description: Obv. 大泉五十 Da Quan Wu Shi (Large coin fifty). Rev. Tortoise, snake, seven-star big dipper, and sword.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 紹興元寶 Shao Xing Yuan Bao (clockwise). Regular script (1131 - 1162 CE). Rev. Crescent above.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 大泉五十 Da Quan Wu Shi (Large coin fifty). Rev. Tortoise, snake, seven-star big dipper, and sword.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 元祐通寶 Yuan You Tong Bao (clockwise). Seal script (1086 - 1093 CE). Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 紹興元寶 Shao Xing Yuan Bao (clockwise). Regular script (1131 - 1162 CE). Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 龍飛鳳舞 Long Fei Feng Wu (The Dragon Flies, The Phoenix Dances). Rev. Dragon and Phoenix with flaming pearl.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾道元寶 Qian Dao Yuan Bao (clockwise). Regular script (1165 - 1173 CE). Rev. Plain.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Bowl Lid
description: Lid for bowl (38-20-1A).  Cover has ring around flat top, slightly rounded sides, flat rim with short vertical overhang.
credit_line: Purchased from Ralph Chait, 1938

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a woman with a bird on left hand.  Made of slate gray clay.  Fired at low heat.  Two part mold front and back.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Pants
description: A pair of woven, indigo-dyed wide-legged pants with 4" waist band; no distinguishing marks.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Plain. Unusual to have a plain reverse. This may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statuette
description: Statuette of carved jade.  Reclining humped buffalo with playful calf.  Mottled dark green jade with pinkish area.  Underside of tail broken off.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Bull, 1984

title: Coin
description: Obv. 慶元通寶 Qing Yuan Tong Bao (clockwise). Rev. 二 Er ( 2 = 1196 CE ).
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 淳祐通寶 Chun You Tong Bao. Rev. 當百 Dang Bai (Equivalent to one hundred). 1241 - 1252 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Running horse below. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. 一錢 Yi Qian (1 qian) right, 錢 qian is abbreviated like 力.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Running horse above. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Running horse below. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Running horse below. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Running horse below. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 元豐通寶 Yuan Feng Tong Bao (clockwise). Running script (1078 - 1085 CE). Rev. Inverted crescent above.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Pigeon Whistle
description: Ko-tze attached to tails of carrier pigeons.Gourd, black and brown, decorated with ornamental band; 3 short bamboo tubes inserted.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, 1951

title: Theatrical Headdress
description: Theatrical headdress resembles a tiara with earflaps. Two dragons with heads attached by springs on each side.  Inlaid with nine mirrors on each side.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Textile
description: Orange-red satin. Couched-on embroidery in shades of blue, rose, green and white, and in gold bullion. Vases of flowers, lions, clouds, and flowers. Peach colored cotton backing.
credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Frances E. (Harry) Markoe, 1943

title: Mandarin Square
description: Pair of seventh rank Mandarin duck squares for wife of official. Apparently a 19th century provincial copy of an 18th century style.
credit_line: Purchased from J. S. Letcher, 1952

title: Mandarin Square
description: Pair of seventh rank Mandarin duck squares for wife of official. Apparently a 19th century provincial copy of an 18th century style.
credit_line: Purchased from J. S. Letcher, 1952

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Ushi left (Manchu script), Ushi right (Uyghur). Mint: Ushi, Xinjiang. 1771 - 1798 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo gu left and right. Mint: Dagu, Zhili. 1896 - 1899 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Yerkiyang left (Manchu script),  يارﻛﻨﺪ Yəkən right (Uyghur). Mint: Yarkant, Xinjiang. 1760 - 1769 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Tablet
description: Medium green jade. Rectangular with incised and gilt Imperial five-toed dragons. Most likely served as the end panel to a jade book. Has a wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Tablet
description: Medium green jade. Rectangular with incised and gilt Imperial five-toed dragons. Most likely served as the front panel to a jade book. Has a wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Whistle
description: Bamboo, black. flat piece of wood to which 10 bamboo tubes are fastened, in rows of five each.  Carved piece of wood underneath
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, 1951

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Boo kiyan left and right, triangle above. Mint: Guizhou province. 1825 - 1850 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Aksu left (Manchu script), ئاقسۇ Aksu right (Uyghur). Mint: Aksu, Xinjiang. 1821 - 1828 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Boo kiyan left and right, triangle above. Mint: Guizhou province. 1825 - 1850 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Mint: The Board of Revenue. 1821 - 1823 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Yerkiyang left (Manchu script),  يارﻛﻨﺪ Yəkən right (Uyghur). Mint: Yarkant, Xinjiang. 1760 - 1769 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 平五十千 (worth fifty thouand). Rev. Plain. Charm. Unusual. Imitating coins from the Wang Mang period (7 -23 CE).
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing Daoist figure. Identical to 8-5-11, 12, except for headgear which is flattened on top and has hanging ribbons on the back.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Vessel
description: Bronze vessel in form of bird with animal head.  Hole in center of top.  Teakwood stand.  Cover missing.  Inlaid with silver.  Traces of gilt.
credit_line: Purchased from the Estate of George Byron Gordon, 1927

title: Mortuary Cup (uncertain)
provenience: China | Near Canton | Mei Wa School Estate
description: Cup without handle.  Small crudely fashioned drinking cup of slate grey clay. Flaring lip, rounding body, slanting to a flat base. Probably made for mortuary use only.
credit_line: Purchased from Mrs. Theodore Greene, 1931

title: Robe
description: Informal woman's red robe.  Wide sleeves, neckbands & front, right side opening.  Large roundels: cranes, butterflies, flowers.  Wide horse-shoe cuffs: cranes & flowers on black ground. Li Shui (upright wave) border at hem.
credit_line: Gift of James Marvin, 2002

title: Vest
description: Man's sleeveless jacket.  Red damask with black borders with 3 brass buttons.  Character yung, courage, in black on white disk front and back.  Four identical(29-96-155A-D).
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Vest
description: Man's sleeveless jacket. Red damask with black borders with 3 brass buttons. Character yung, courage, in black on white disk front and back. Four identical(29-96-155A-D).
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Vest
description: Man's sleeveless jacket. Red damask with black borders with 3 brass buttons. Character yung, courage, in black on white disk front and back. Four identical(29-96-155A-D).
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Vest
description: Man's sleeveless jacket.  Red damask with black borders with 3 brass buttons.  Character yung, courage, in black on white disk front and back. Four identical(29-96-155A-D).
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Figurine
description: Figure of a boy holding a vase in right hand. Head is restored and repainted. Green coat with floral pattern and yellow skirt with floral pattern. Pair with 64-8-11
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Chinese Ritual Vessel
description: Covered vessel, Dou.  On tall stem.  Narrow bands of design in very low flat relief on interlaced geometric dragon motifs.  Slight malachite green and bright blue patina.
credit_line: Museum Purchase, 1929

title: Ritual Vessel Lid
description: Lid to bronze ding with green patina.  On the inside of the lid is an image of an ox head.
credit_line: Purchased from C. T. Loo, 1941

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Wenchang Zitong Dijun (文昌 梓童 帝君), god of literature and wealth.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults.  Siming zhi Shen (司命 之 神), the god who controls destiny.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Xiaogong zhi Shen (蕭公  之 神). The Spirit of Mr. Xiaogong.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chuwan left and right. Mint: Chengdu, Sichuan. The Board of Revenue type. 1855 - 1861 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Drawer
description: Wooden drawer from inside box (50-6-1.1B).  Lined with yellow silk.  One outer edge is also edge of box, has ivory inlay.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Statuette
description: Wooden. Guanyin seated on a throne with a child on her knee. Crude and wormeaten.  Guanyin as Madonna and child modeled after the Christian motif.  Chinese Jesuit figure.
credit_line: Gift of W. H. Miller (?), 1916

title: Charm
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chuwan left and right. In the shape of a peach, a symbol of longevity. Unusual.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. The floral motif on the reverse indicates this is a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Imperial Statuette
description: Statuette of lady with dragon.  Imperial coral carving.  C686 and C687 are a pair.  Wooden stand is C686B.
credit_line: Purchased from Wanamaker's Department Store; subscription of Eldridge R. Johnson, 1927

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing Daoist figure identical to 80-5-11, wearing a long robe, hands clasped in front and hidden by sleeves. Double peaked headgear with badge.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Coin
description: Obv. 乾隆通寶 Qian Long Tong Bao. Rev. Aksu left (Manchu script), ئاقسۇ Aksu right (Uyghur script). Mint: Aksu, Xinjiang. 1761 - 1766 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Slipper
description: Child's shoe.  One of a pair.  Shaped and decorated to resemble a pig.  Snout and ears at toe with embroidered eyes and tail at back.  Brown cloth sole.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Slipper
description: Child's shoe.  One of a pair.  Shaped and decorated to resemble a pig.  Snout and ears at toe with embroidered eyes and tail at back.  Brown cloth sole.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a civilian.  C221 and C222 are a pair.  They wear round top-knots and lean forward.  Slate grey clay with red over it.  Fake.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a civilian.  C221 and C222 are a pair.  They wear round top-knots and lean forward.  Slate grey clay with red over it.  Fake.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a civilian.  There is a difference in the headdresses of C219 and C220 although they are a pair.  Slate grey clay with red over it.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Mortuary Figurine
description: Mortuary figurine of a civilian.  There is a difference in the headdresses of C219 and C220 although they are a pair.  Slate grey clay with red over it.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Leggings
description: A pair of leggings (guards), woven of dark blue cotton with undyed linings, fastened with five light blue frogs.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Leggings
description: A pair of leggings (guards), woven of dark blue cotton with undyed linings, fastened with five light blue frogs.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Vase
description: Amphora shape. Even peachbloom glaze, interior and exterior, with interior areas of green. Mouthrim slightly glazed pink. Recessed base glazed white with blue six character mark of Kangxi. Footrim unglazed. Ivory stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Mirror
description: Bronze mirror with low flat rim and decoration in raised lines of bronze. It has nipple and geometric dragon motifs. It was broken into two pieces but has since been mended.
credit_line: Museum Purchase, 1929

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults.  Nanfang Huode Xingjun (南方 火德 星君), the Star God of Fire.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Xigui zhi Shen (喜貴 之 神), the gods of happiness and honors.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Guan Li zhi Shen (管科 之 神), the god who controls prosperity.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治重寶 Tong Zhi Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. 當十 Dang Shi (Value Ten) above and below. Mint: The Board of Revenue.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. Boo su left and right. Mint: Suzhou and other mints, Jiangsu. 1851 - 1854 CE. Coastal province type.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Amulet
description: Obv. 正德通寶 Zheng De Tong Bao. Rev. Dragon and Phoenix. Amulet minted during the Ming Dynasty. It is thought to bring good luck in gambling.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo di left and right. 當十 Dang Shi (Value Ten) above and below. Mint: Urumchi (Dihua), Xinjiang. 1857 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 正德通寶 Zheng De Tong Bao. Rev. Dragon and Phoenix. Amulet minted during the Ming Dynasty. It is thought to bring good luck in gambling.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo di left and right. 當八 Dang Ba (Value Eight) above and below. Mint: Urumchi (Dihua), Xinjiang. 1857 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Mint: The Board of Revenue. 1887 - 1898 CE.Unusual thickness, possibly a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 正德通寶 Zheng De Tong Bao. Rev. Dragon and Phoenix. Amulet minted during the Ming Dynasty. It is thought to bring good luck in gambling.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Amulet
description: Obv. 正德通寶 Zheng De Tong Bao. Rev. Dragon and Phoenix. Amulet minted during the Ming Dynasty. It is thought to bring good luck in gambling.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Bowl Lid
description: Lid for bowl (38-20-2A).  Solid silver with floral pattern in gold niello.  Cover had ring (now missing) around slightly rounded top and sides; flat rim with short vertical overhang.
credit_line: Purchased from Ralph Chait, 1938

title: Headband
description: Woman's headband. Beaded. Upper and lower bands of black with a purple band in center. Purple band has beaded floral designs in gray, black, pink and light blue beads. Coarse red backing.
credit_line: Gift of M. B. Kirkpatrick, Jr., 1920

title: Cuff
description: One of a pair of cuffs or sleeve bands. Silk with metallic gold and colored silk thread embroidery. Scene with horses under trees.
credit_line: Gift of Dr. Harold A. Wilkinson in memory of Roselise H. Wilkinson, M.D., 2011

title: Cuff
description: One of a pair of cuffs or sleeve bands. Silk with metallic gold and colored silk thread embroidery. Scene with horses under trees.
credit_line: Gift of Dr. Harold A. Wilkinson in memory of Roselise H. Wilkinson, M.D., 2011

title: Informal Robe
description: Blue-green silk coat with quilted red lining inside and floral embroidery outside. Bottom has wavy vertical stripes of red, blue, turquoise, olive green and faded violet.
credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Frances E. (Harry) Markoe, 1943

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed figure of a guardian which is a companion to 80-5-1. The position of the dragon is reversed with it's head (now broken off) held in the left hand.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Guan Ku zhi Shen (管庫 之 神) the god who controls warehouses.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. Cao Gong zhi Shen (曺公  之 神). The Spirit of Mr.Cao Gong.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Coin
description: Obv. 康熙通寶 Kang Xi Tong Bao. Rev. Je left, 浙 Zhe right. Mint: Hangzhou, Zhejiang. 1667 - 1674 CE.Possibly a charm based on the unusual rim.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 永通泉貨 Yong Tong Quan Huo (Eternal Circulation Coin). Rev. Lucky clouds below. Rare. Unusual to have clouds on reverse, this may be charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Game
description: 32 wooden game pieces. 16 are dark wood, 16 are light wood. Each has a chinese character carved on one side.  All pieces are disk-shaped.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Saucer
description: Qingbai ware saucer. Thin and brittle greenish glaze. Unglazed rim. Glaze is swirled over flat base. Foliate design on interior of saucer. Said to be from Jiangxi tomb.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo gui left and right. 當十 Dang Shi ( Value Ten) above and below. Mint: Guilin, Guangxi. 1853 - 1854 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 小泉值一 Xiao Quan Zhi Yi.  Rev. Plain. Modern characters. Imitating a coin from the first century but probably a charm given the modern Chinese characters.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing Daoist figure earing a long shawl, collared robe, hands clasped in front under long sleeves. Small hat with back ribbons; hair, indicated by striations shown in front of hat.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Theatrical Headdress
description: Front of theatrical headdress. Black velvet base with crown made of gilded leather. Piece has several dragons on it with their heads attached to their bodies by springs. Two red silk flowers on top.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Collar
description: A bib-like collar of stained red leather; a tan leather binding is sewn along all edges; two brown cotton frogs with metal balls fasten neck opening.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Cuff
description: One of a pair of cuffs or sleeve bands. Silk with metallic gold and colored silk thread embroidery.  Garden scene with two women.
credit_line: Gift of Dr. Harold A. Wilkinson in memory of Roselise H. Wilkinson, M.D., 2011

title: Cuff
description: One of a pair of cuffs or sleeve bands. Silk with metallic gold and colored silk thread embroidery.  Garden scene with man and woman.
credit_line: Gift of Dr. Harold A. Wilkinson in memory of Roselise H. Wilkinson, M.D., 2011

title: Textile Panel
description: Panel with two dragons; not a square of rank. This is a common folk motif executed in folk embroidery techniques. Probably made for a bridal pillow (or some other useful function) for a wedding gift.
credit_line: Purchased from J. S. Letcher, 1952

title: Brush Holder
description: Porcelaneous stoneware. Round cylinder shape with turned lip. Thick running glaze of ox-blood, greyish white at top and inside ring of white. Unglazed footrim. Slightly recessed base with glassy red and white glaze. Unsigned.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Vase
description: Langyao ox blood crackle glaze and spotted exterior. Long neckslightly tapering, flowing into round bulbous body, with low round foot. Interior with pale greenish yellow crackle glaze. Recessed foot with pale crack glaze. Unglazed footrim. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Rouge Box
description: Round cushion shape with fitted halves (A and B) with peachbloom glaze with prized green fleckings. Interior white glaze. Recessed base with white glaze has six character mark of Kangxi. Unglazed footrim and mouth. Ivory stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Mouth Organ
description: Small mouth organ with 16 bamboo pipes of graduated lengths.  The pipes are fitted with free reeds and are inserted into top of wooden air chamber with mouthpiece on one side.  Good condition.  Some pipes are unglued
credit_line: Gift of the Franklin Institute, 2014

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults.  Xuan tan Zhao yuan shuai (玄壇 趙 元帥). Wealth god of the Mystic Altar.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Amulet
description: Obv. 亥 Hai (The Zodiac character for the pig). Pig below. Rev. Fu character. The pig is the twelfth of the twelve zodiac animals. Also corresponds to 9 P.M. - 11 P.M.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. 當十 Dang shi (Value Ten) above and below. Mint: The Board of Revenue. June 1853 - February 1854 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 大泉五十 Da Quan Wu Shi (Large coin fifty). Rev. Dot above. This is a charm imitating a coin from the Wang Mang period (7-23 CE).
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 招财进宝 (Money and treasures will be plentiful. Attracts wealth and treasure)  黄金萬兩 (Riches on riches [myriads of gold and taels]. Rev. Tartar with a lion and ball.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Snuff Bottle
description: Glass snuff bottle.  Painting on interior.  One side with landscape with water and on other side three gentlemen in landscape.  Raised design in class on narrow sides.
credit_line: Gift of Roger H. Clarke III in memory of Roger H. (Pete) Clarke Jr., 1997

title: Rattle
description: Plaster rattle, round, painted with floral decorations, two bells hanging from sides; mounted on red stick. Some paint chipped off, one bell is missing and rattle is detached from stick.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, 1951

title: Hood
description: A woven, dyed, hand-sewn infant's cotton hood; solid red exterior, light blue lining; floral flaps (white, red, purple), fastened with light blue frog, hand-sewn to the interior.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Canopy
description: A canopy or tent, woven of cotton, printed in floral and leaf pattern in India resist dye, blue, white with a closed top of plain cloth with an opening.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Figurine
description: Porcelain figure of a boy, holding a vase in left hand, two fingers missing. Finger on right hand is also missing. Paint on top knot chipped. Green coat with floral pattern and yellow skirt with floral pattern. Pair with 64-8-12.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Jar
provenience: China | Near Canton | Mei Wa School Estate
description: Globular pottery jar. Of very light buff clay. Round with large collar neck. Impressed with cross hatching design in three zones, on top of which is impressed a row of small disk coin-like motives.  Made by coil method?
credit_line: Purchased from Mrs. Theodore Greene, 1931

title: Vase
description: Pear-shaped body with Langyao glaze. Top with crackle apple green glaze overlapping the "sang de boeuf" glaze. White lip with inside yellowish green fish roe crackle glaze. Heavily potted with unglazed footrim and fine crackle glaze on bottom. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Bottle
description: Camellia leaf green bottle vase. Round globular body with sloped shoulders tapering into tubular neck with small mouth with iron brown lip and short foot. Fish roe crackle glaze exterior. Camellia green glazed interior and recessed base. Unglazed footrim. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Wine Cup
description: Eggshell porcelain. Wide mouth with flared shape with exterior yellow crackled glaze. Interior white glaze. Low round foot. Recessed base has white glaze with blue double ring with six character mark of Yongzheng. Footrim unglazed. Chip out of one cup.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo fu left and right. 五十 Wu shi (Fifty [cash]). Mint: Fuzhou, Fujian. 1853 - 1855 CE. The radiating lines on the reverse may mean this is a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 雍正通寶 Yong Zheng Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Mint: The Board of Revenue. Possibly a charm or an amulet based on the floral decorations on outside of the obverse and reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Aksu left (Manchu script), ئاقسۇ Aksu right (Uyghur). 八年 Ba Nian (8th year) above. 十 Shi (10 [cash] below). Mint: Aksu, Xinjiang. 1828 - 1850 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Unusual to have the obverse and reverse be the same as the reverse usually has mint information. This may be charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 宣和通寶 Xuan He Tong Bao. Li script (1119 - 1125 CE). Rev. Plain. Possibly Bita Sen imitating Song Dynasty 宣和通寶 Xuan He Tong Bao Chinese coin. Obv. Sen Wa Tsu Ho.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. Boo ji left and right. Mint: Jinan, Shandong. The character for ᠵᡳ ji on the reverse is unsual for this Emperor. This may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. Guang (Manchu) left, 廣 Guang right. 平庫一錢 Ku ping yi qian (Treasury scales one qian) above and below. Mint: Guangzhou, Guangdong. 1889 - 1890 CE. Struck coin.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.   Fancy rock.  2 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Wall Hanging
description: Red flannel wall hanging featuring embroidered/appliqued scene of Tang General Guo Ziyi (697-781 CE) and family. General/wife seated at center in house, flanked by children and grandchildren coming/going. Floral motif with fish, etc. below. Wide green netting with tassles hang from bottom.
credit_line: Gift of James Marvin, 2002

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870. Fancy rock. 3 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Cloth
description: A bolt of cloth woven of cotton, indigo resist dyed, block printed in line of butterflies in an all over pattern of diamond-like designs ending with a plain blue border.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Robe
description: A ramie robe of dark blue and white small check; rounded neck curves down to an overlap opening that is secured down to the right side with 4 frogs of the same check material.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Skirt
description: A heavily pleated skirt woven of black silk, with undyed cotton waistband, two green silk ties with purple fringes both attached at top to narrow undyed strip, which pulls through two loops at waistband.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Water Coupe
description: Squat beehive body with short neck with small mouth. Three etched floral scroll medallions on body with overall clair de lune glaze. Bottom has six character marks in underglazed blue. Interior including mouth and lip has white glaze. Unglazed footrim. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Oboe
description: Conical oboe.  Mouthpiece, stem disc, 2 spherical bulges, disc metal.  Wood pipe: 7 frontal holes, 1 dorsal hole, each in its own groove carved around pipe.  Slender conical pipe, wide and inserted into conical metal bell with offset ring around center.  Good condition
credit_line: Gift of the Franklin Institute, 2014

title: Coin
description: Obv. 順治通寶 Shun Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. 東 Dong right. Mint: Jinan, Shandong. Opened in 1649 CE. 1649 - 1651 CE. Nominal weight 1.2 qian based on mint name on the reverse being to the right of the hole.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐元寶 Xian Feng Yuan Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Unusual to have 元 Yuan on the obverse instead of 通 Tong when the reverse has just the mint mark and no denomination. This may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Tray
description: Wooden tray with formed compartments for objects relating to the scholar's kit.  Yellow silk lining, compartments are lined with red fabric (silk?).  Edges of tray are decorated with carved scroll work.  Fits inside box (50-6-1.1B).
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John S. Jenks, 1950

title: Coin
description: Obv. 宣和通寶 Xuan He Tong Bao. Seal script (1119 - 1125 CE). Rev. Plain. Possibly Bita Sen imitating Song Dynasty 宣和通寶 Xuan He Tong Bao Chinese coin. Obv. Sen Wa Tsu Ho. Seal script.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Spade Coin
description: Flat handled, arched foot spade. Liang Dang Lie. Half jin Liang coin. Obv. 梁半尚二金當寽 Liang Ban Shang Er Jin Dang Lie. Liang superior money, half (unit), two equal to one lie. Rev. Plain. State of Liang. Rare.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 永通萬國 [永通万国] Yong Tong Wan Guo (Everlasting Circulation in Ten Thousand Kingdoms). Rev. Snake, sword, tortoise, seven-star big dipper. The obverse is based on a coin produced by Emperor Xuan during the Northern Zhou Dynasty in 579 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao with radiating lines. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right, three dots (stars) above and crescent below. Mint: The Board of Revenue. 1851 - 1853 CE. This is most likley a charm or amulet.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statuette
description: Bronze figure of Amitabha standing on low lotus pedestal.  Right hand raised, palm outward.  Left hand low and forward, palm out.  Long ears. Tightly curled hair of Indian type. Halo missing.
credit_line: Purchased from C. T. Loo; Subscription of A. Felix du Pont, 1938

title: Print
description: Chinese wood block print.  Fancy rock.  4 color.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.  Two rocks with wrinkles.  1 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Two rocks vertically stratified.  3 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.   Rock with green grass.  1 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.  Fancy rock in a circle.  4 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Rock in a circle with water.  2 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Rock in a circle.  2 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Fancy rock with wrinkles.   3 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Bird on branch.  Black and grey.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Bamboo study.  Black and grey.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Skirt
description: A heavily pleated skirt of two pieces of woven cotton cloth.  The top piece is dyed blue, the bottom is undyed, and yarn dyed indigo blue geometric pattern.  Two undyed narrow ties are sewn on each end of the waistband.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.  Fancy rock.  4 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.   Peony study in a circle.  4 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).   Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Two rocks vertically stratified. 3 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Three pomagranates on a branch.  4 color. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.  Fancy rock with verdure.  3 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.   Fancy rock.  Black, grey, lavender.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.  Fancy rock with grass.  Black and grey.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Seal Box
description: Round cushion shape with peach pink glaze with paler center. Green tones at mouth area. Fitted top and bottom. Interior white glaze top and bottom halves. Slightly recessed base with white glaze. Glaze varies slightly. Six character mark of Kangxi in underglaze blue. Unglazed footrim. Ivory stand. (B)
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Water Coupe
description: Round squat shallow dish with inward curling sides and wide mouth. Peach bloom glaze: interior has off white and greenish glaze. Round indented low foot with pronounced peach bloom glaze. Recessed base with off white and greenish glaze with six character mark of Kangxi in blue. Wooden stand (B).
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Vase
description: Porcelaneous stoneware bottle with Kingfisher blue glaze, exterior and interior. Flattened, ovoid shape with long slender neck and ovoid footed base. Fish roe crackle glaze. Subtle greenish glaze used to depict two branches of flowers at each side over crackle glaze. Recessed base and footrim unglazed. No mark. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Coin
description: Obv. 同治通寶 Tong Zhi Tong Bao. Rev. 丁財貴壽 Ding Cai Gui Shou (May you acquire wealth, honor [high rank] and longevity). This is most likley a charm or amulet as the reverse doesn't feature mint information but rather an auspcious saying. Unusual.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 光緒通寶 Guang Xu Tong Bao. Rev. 丁財貴壽 Ding Cai Gui Shou (May you acquire wealth, honor [high rank] and longevity). This is most likley a charm or amulet as the reverse doesn't feature mint information but rather an auspcious saying. Unusual.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Dagger-Axe
description: Bronze dagger-axe (Ge 戈).  Blade with extension and long tang.  Bevelled edge on both sides of blade and part of tang.  T-shaped cross section at juncture of blade and tang with three rectangular holes on blade side.  Single hole in tang.  Pale green patina.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Bull, 1984

title: Pole Finial
description: Bronze pole finial.  Hollow socket with two curving horn-like projections.  Exterior low relief of bovine face and horns with segmented scroll motif.  Heavily encrusted patina on one side and hole worn through near base.  Hole on either side near raised eyes of bovine.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Bull, 1984

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐元寶 Xian Feng Yuan Bao. Rev. Boo u left and right. 當百 Dang bai (Value One Hundred) above and below. Mint: Wuchang, Hebei. 1854 - 1856 CE. The dots (stars) and crescents on the reverse may indicate this is a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv.臨安府行用 Lin An Fu Xing Yong ([For] Lin An Prefecture use).  Rev.準伍佰文省 Zhun Yi Shi Wen Sheng (Equal to 10 cash reduced).  These are also known as 铮牌 Qian Pai, or coin tallies.1260 - 1264 CE. Very rare.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Print
description: Chinese wood block print.  Fancy rock with verdure.  2 color.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Study of fruit in a circle:  2 peaches.  4 color. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Print
description: Chinese wood block print.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.  Two rocks with vertical stratification.  2 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Baby Carrier
description: Dong baby carrier.  Embroidered and woven pieces of cloth on black cotton appliqued together.  Large rectangular central panel with two tie ends cut off and long narrow flap.  Partially lined.  Narrow red cotton border on central panel and flap.  Embroidery of circular medallions and flowers in natural, pink, salmon, green.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Baylis, 1998

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for isnertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Sash
description: A woven, embroidered cotton woman's sash (Ceinture), folded over and stitched together at a number of places; red and blue embroidery gives sash a "window pane" design; four inches of each end embroidered in a geometric design in red and blue.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Sash
description: A long sash woven of undyed cotton, embroidered with various bands of geometric designs in dark blue at each end; a band of embroidery decorates the center, a fringe of finely twisted cords is sewn to each end.  One side is hemmed.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Frieze
description: Gray stone frieze fragment depicting seven figures.  Three grouped in center have nimbuses.  Two are kneeling.  All have hands clasped except one, taller than the rest wearing a necklace.  His right hand with last two fingers extended.  Basket in his left hand.  Set with C418, C419, and C420.
credit_line: Purchased from Spink & Son, 1924

title: Print
description: Chinese wood block print.  Fancy rock in a circle.  2 color.  Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Apron
description: Black cotton with colorful embroidery at both longer ends. Made of cross stitches, each end has a different pattern. Maybe an apron. The tag says, "From Tibet box unnumbered-with boots, belts, textiles, hat."
credit_line: Academy of Natural Sciences / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Theatrical Headdress
description: Front part of Chinese theatrical headdress. Black velvet covered with black and gold lines. Front is a curved rectangle decorated with a green silk square with gold lining and a swastika-like symbol at the center.  It also has a blue, circular symbol with gold lines and gold Chinese inscriptions at each side.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Jar
provenience: China | Near Canton | Mei Wa School Estate
description: Globular pottery jar.  Of very light buff clay.  Round with large collar neck.  Impressed with cross hatching design in three zones.  A row of disk coin-like impressions around the middle on top of the cross hatching.  The surface of the clay has turned grayish in some areas especially inside the jar.
credit_line: Purchased from Mrs. Theodore Greene, 1931

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Study of lotus seed pods.  3 color. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-1 to 35-5-95 are from an edition printed before 1870.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed. standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something, the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Wine Jar
description: Form of wine jar of Li Po (poet of the Tang Dynasty). Crab's claw crackle apple green glaze exterior. Interior with pale celadon crackled glaze. Base has a dark olive green banded low foot. Recessed base with pale crackled celadon glaze with iron brown band inside. Unglazed foot rim. Unsigned. Ivory stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Bottle
description: One of a pair of vessels with molded decoration. White stoneware with cream colored finely crackled glaze. Body round and lobed. Short pedestal foot. Long narrow neck with four knobs at center. Vertical ribs on neck. Widens at rim with petal like phalange near upper rim.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard C. Bull, 1987

title: Charm
description: Bronze amulet in the shape of a coin with a square center.  The inscription on the obverse, in seal script (xiaozhuan), reads: 富貴昌樂 Fu Gui Chang Le, "wealth, prestige, prosperity and happiness.”The reverse has an inscription with eight characters: 三官公君士宜主長.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐元寶 Xian Feng Yuan Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. 當千 Dang qian ( Value One Thousand) above and below. Mint: The Board of Revenue. March - August 1854 CE. The lines radiating out on the reverse indicate this may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo fu left and right. MInt: Fuzhou, Fujian. 1853 - 1855 CE. Unusual to have 重 Zhong on the obverse instead of 通 Tong when the reverse has just the mint mark and no denomination. This may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo su left and right. 當三十 Dang San Shi (Value Thirty). 1854 - 1855 CE. May be an amulet or charm based on the radiating lines on the obverse and the crescents and dots (stars) on the reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chang left and right. 當五十 Dang Wushi (Value Fifty) above and below. Mint: Nanchang, Jiangxi. 1855 - 1860 CE. The obverse has dots (stars) and the reverse has radiating lines which means this is probably a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Puzzle
description: Puzzle made of carved ivory rod with four ivory disk beads and string.  Rod has holes at ends and center and is carved with branches over a ribbed background. String is threaded through the holes and the beads are threaded on the string.  Puzzle is to re-arrange the position of the beads on the string.
credit_line: Gift of Mary Ansley, 1898

title: Coin
description: Obv. 崇禎通寶 Chong Zhen Tong Bao. Rev. Horses above and below, facing left and right. Known as a 跑馬 Pao Ma, Running Horse Coin. Unusual. This may be an imitation of a coin that usually has only one horse above or below on the reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo gui left and right. 當十 Dang shi (Value Ten) above and below. Mint: Guilin, Guangxi. 1853 - 1854 CE. Most likley a charm based on the stars (dots) and crescents on the obverse and the radiating lines on the reverse.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Statuette
description: Unglazed, standing figure of a Daoist, hands folded across chest, a gap between palms and thumbs allowing for insertion of something; the figure is dressed in a long robe with pointed, long sash in front and buckle with hanging ribbons in back. On headdress is the character 王, Wang.
credit_line: Purchased from the Delaware Art Museum, Wilmington, 1980

title: Incense Burner
description: Incense burner in form of a bowl on a high stem with a high hill-shaped cover crowned with a fleur-de-lys ornament. 3 slits in the sides of the cover. Two bands of ornaments made with finely incised lines freely drawn on cover. Of buff sandy clay with traces of dark brown glaze.
credit_line: Purchased from Mrs. Theodore Greene, 1931

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Study of a short-needled pine tree, in a circle.  4 color. Illustration from the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)" a manual for artists, first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672).  Prints 35-5-97 to 35-5-195 are from an edition printed in 1879.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Bowl
description: Flared bowls with low foot. Outside deep blue gilt vertical panels with architectural and figural design, alternating with vertical diaper cell panels. Bat design rim. Inside white glaze with iron red, green and yellow. Five clawed Imperial Dragon with cloud symbols. Apocryphal mark of Cheng Hua. Circular gilt feather design at foot of basin. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Bowl
description: Flared bowls with low foot. Outside deep blue gilt vertical panels with architectural and figural design, alternating with vertical diaper cell panels. Bat design rim. Inside white glaze with iron red, green and yellow. Five clawed Imperial Dragon with cloud symbols. Apocryphal mark of Cheng Hua. Circular gilt feather design at foot of basin. Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right, dot below. Mint: The Board of Revenue.  It is unusual to have dot on the reverse with chiowan as this is more typical of coins with kiyan on the reverse. This may be a charm or amulet.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chang left and right. Mint: Nanchang, Jiangxi. The Board of Revenue type. 1854 - 1856 CE. The manchu character Chang on the reverse is unusual and resembles those on ten and fifty value coins. This is possibly a charm or amulet.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Imperial Statuette
description: Statuette of lady with phoenix.  Imperial coral carving.  C686 and C687 are a pair.  Wooden stand is C687B. These statues were each carved from a single piece of coral. The phoenix probably represented the empress. Coral carvings were often displayed on the desks of scholars and officials.
credit_line: Purchased from Wanamaker's Department Store; subscription of Eldridge R. Johnson, 1927

title: Charm
description: Obv.文星高照 Wen Xing Gao Zhao (The Star of Literature Shines on High) with Kuixing 魁星, the God of Literature and Examinations. Rev. 一品當朝 Yi Pin Dang Chao (First Rank Official at the Court) 状元及第 Zhuang Yuan Ji Di (First Place in the Palace Examinations).16 dots border.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Textile
description: A woman's shirt woven of silk, consisting of 3 panels; the main body of green, black, and gold woven in a finely striped pattern; one end narrow black band with white stitching; the other in alternating wide red stripes and narrower green and orange sewn together with one seam.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Leggings
description: One of a pair of leggings woven of black cotton, lined in blue.  Bottom shaped to cover instep with a tie on either side, shorter tie laces through slit and ties; six metal tabs on outer edge fastens through cotton loops to tighten leggings; the top has a curved edge.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Charm
description: Obv. Zhang Tianshi 張天師 "Celestial Master Zhang". Rev. Twelve earthly branches of the zodiac with corresponding Chinese character and animal (starting at the bottom, moving clockwise):子(rat), 丑 (ox), 寅 (tiger), 卯 (rabbit), 辰 (dragon), 巳 (snake), 午 (horse), 未 (goat), 申 (monkey), 酉 (rooster), 戌 (dog), 亥 (pig). See 29-127-1575 for a similar example.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Lid
description: Round cushion shape with peach pink glaze with paler center. Green tones at mouth area. Fitted top and bottom. Interior white glaze top and bottom halves. Slightly recessed base with white glaze. Glaze varies slightly the green glaze on 88-10-37A is much more pronounced. Six character mark of Kangxi in underglaze blue. Unglazed footrim. Ivory stand. (b)
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chang left and right. Three Dots above. Mint: Nanchang, Jiangxi. The Board of Revenue type. 1854 - 1856 CE. The manchu character Chang on the reverse is unusual and resembles those on ten and fifty value coins. The dots (stars) indicate this may be an amulet or charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐元寶 Xian Feng Yuan Bao. Rev. Boo chiowan left and right. Dots (stars) above and below. Unusual to have 元 Yuan on the obverse instead of 通 Tong when the reverse has just the mint mark and no denomination. This is in combination with the dots on the reverse indicate this may be a charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Gourd-shaped amulet or charm in the shape of a double coin. Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao (The Currency of Dao Guang), 指日高陞 Zhi Ri Gao Sheng (Shortly High Promotion). Rev. Eight trigrams Ba Gua (八卦) and seven stars with Kui Xing (魁星) on the Ao ( 鰲)fish.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Jackstraws
creator: Unknown
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
creator: Unknown
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
creator: Unknown
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Jackstraws
creator: Unknown
description: One carved sandalwood jackstraws from the following set.  11 plain straws five to three inches long, one broken(7586 A-K).  3 axes(7586 L-N), 1 sword(7586 O), 1 conical headed spear(7586 P), 1 triangular headed spear(7586 Q), 1 paddle(7586 R), 1 gun(7586 S), 1 square headed paddle(7586 T), 1 square headed knobed maul(7586 U).
credit_line: Gift of Francis C. Macauley, 1891

title: Dagger-Axe
description: Bronze. Wide blade with slightly concave cutting edges, slightly convex back, and blunt point; barlike guard, flat, slightly curved grip. Both faces of grip inlaid with red stone (?) in scroll pattern; remains of basketry (sheath?) on both faces of blade. Green and red patination. One small square hole in blade; slightly larger round hole in grip.
credit_line: Purchased from Mathias Komor, 1945

title: Umbrella Fitting
description: Bronze chariot umbrella fitting.  Circular disc with six movable tapered spokes.  Three spokes broken off except for base.  Three spokes and one spoke base are still free swinging.  Other two spoke bases are corroded to disc.  Tubular socket attached to circular disc by six faceted supports with low relief dragon heads at top.  Green patina.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Bull, 1984

title: Leggings
description: One of a pair of leggings woven of black cotton, lined in blue.  Bottom shaped to cover instep with a tie on either side, shorter tie laces through slit and ties; six metal tabs on outer edge fastens through cotton loops to tighten leggings; the top has a curved edge.  Yarn-dyed.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Baby Carrier
description: Central panel of Miao Baby carrier.  No ties.  Indigo cotton and silk thread.  Panels consisting of embroidered, woven and appliqued sections stitched together into a large T-shaped textile.  Variety of stitching techniques, including rare ladder stitch, a form of embroidery in which twisted threads are tapped down to form a ladder pattern.  Brightly colored rich in red and purple.  Extremely fine workmanship.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Baylis, 1998

title: Bowl
description: Bowl.  Shallow shape with refactory buff toned paste of the Jiangxi potteries, made during the Southern Song Dynasty. The interior shows a pale old ivory toned glaze with a curious biscuit (unglazed) ring at the bottom, while the exterior has an interesting pale greenish yellow, and finely cracked glaze of the rare Mise variety. Largely copied during the Qing Dynasty.
credit_line: Purchased from the Duveen Brothers, 1918

title: Lute
description: Genkwan ( ?) . Octagonal body of light orange-brown wood.  Long neck with 11 frets (1 missing) and another one on the body (12 altogether).  Metal vibrator within body.  4 silk strings and lateral pegs.  All strings and pegs are missing. The original tag is on the backside of the sound box with two readable Chinese characters "玉" and "x昌". Fair condition.
credit_line: Gift of the Franklin Institute, 2014

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐重寶 Xian Feng Zhong Bao. Rev. Boo chang left and right. Dot above and crescent below. Mint: Nanchang, Jiangxi. The Board of Revenue type. 1854 - 1856 CE. The manchu character Chang on the reverse is unusual and resembles those on ten and fifty value coins. The dot and crescent indicate this may be an amulet or charm.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 周元通寶 Zhou Yuan Tong Bao  (Zhou first currency). Rev. Dragon on the left, phoenix on the right. This charm is based on a coin from the Later Zhou Dynasty (951 - 960 CE) which had been cast using bronze from Buddhist statues melted down on the order of Emperor Shizong starting in 956 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Buckle
description: A jade buckle with two stylized dragons surrounding central, oval tablet which contains Chinese text. One side reads: 金玉滿堂 (Jin yu man tang) "Gold and jade fill the hall". The other says: 玉堂富貴 (Yu tang fu gui) "Jade Hall [metaphor for professional or scholarly advancement], wealth, and prestige". It is in fitted case blue case (88-10-77B).
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Charm
description: Obv. 周元通寶 Zhou Yuan Tong Bao  (Zhou first currency). Rev. Dragon on the left, phoenix on the right. This charm is based on a coin from the Later Zhou Dynasty (951 - 960 CE) which had been cast using bronze from Buddhist statues melted down on the order of Emperor Shizong starting in 956 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Charm
description: Obv. 周元通寶 Zhou Yuan Tong Bao  (Zhou first currency). Rev. Dragon on the left, flaming pearl on the right. This charm is based on a coin from the Later Zhou Dynasty (951 - 960 CE) which had been cast using bronze from Buddhist statues melted down on the order of Emperor Shizong starting in 956 CE.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Coin
description: Obv. 道光通寶 Dao Guang Tong Bao. Rev. 天下太平 Tian Xia Tai Ping (Heaven below Great Peace - Peace on Earth). Tianxi Taiping coin. Also known as a "coin of the imperial court" 宮廷錢 Gong Ting Qian or just 宮錢.  Coins like this were used in the Palace of Ancestral Worship and replaced when a new emperor began their reign. Rare.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Hanging
description: Blue silk. Rectangular, with short overdrape. On overdrape; three Chinese characters is gold surrounded by bats in a ring; also flowers. In center of drape, a gold and black elephant with tiger stripes and tiger claws with saddle cloth and case of flowers, surrounded by flowers and bats. Embroidery is in black, white and shades of blue, pink, green, gold bullion is used. Blue cotton binding at top; pink silk lining.
credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Frances E. (Harry) Markoe, 1943

title: Figurine
description: Porcelain figurine from a set of three pack horses each with an attendant. The attendant is dressed in black pants, a green coat, and a light green hat. He is standing next to a black horse with a green and purple saddle blanket with a wave design at the bottom. The horse is supported on an oblong base made of biscuit porcelain relieved with a geometrical design in green and yellow.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Jacket
description: A woven cotton jacket with a black top and bottom of primarily red, yellow, blue and white pieces or strips of cloth sewn toegther horizontally and vertically; collar, from center of back completely "studded" in metal; same type of studs attached in organized pattern on bottom; red cotton loops and metal balls used to close front.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Skirt
description: Narrow skirt; bottom woven of heavy yarn-dyed cotton and metallic thread.  Two identical panels sewn together; patterned with horizontal bands of blues, reds, purples, greens; top of light woven cotton piece dyed green (badly faded) with four vertical panels of light strips, (piece dyed white, red, gold and blue) pieced into front center.  Yarn dyed and piece dyed.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Print
description: Woodblock print.  Illustration said to come from an 1879 edition of the "Studio of the Mustard Seed Garden" a manual for artists, first printed in 1679. However it is most likely from the Rounds Fans section of an 1879 edition of the "Ten Bamboo Studio Manual of Calligraphy and Painting (Shizhuzhai shuhua pu)"  first printed circa 1633 by Hu Zhengyan (1582 - 1672). Large chrysanthemum on a rock, in a circle.  4 color.
credit_line: Purchased from S. Matsumoto, 1935

title: Apron
description: Dark green cotton with pink, orange and green embroidery at both longer ends. The embroidery is cross stitches, severely worn out. Orange tassels are attached to four corners. Maybe an apron. The tag says, "From Tibet box unnumbered-with boots, belts, textiles, hat."  The label says "152, #5."
credit_line: Academy of Natural Sciences / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Bowl
description: Pair of round deep flared bowls with round low foot. Interior with imperial yellow glaze with green enamelled center circle with seal style character "shou" engraved in bottom. Exterior yellow glaze with enamelled Imperial Dragons and Imperial Phoenix birds with sacred flames and clouds. Stylized green enamelled design on base. Yellow low foot. Recessed base with white glaze. Six character mark of Kangxi in blue within double blue ring. Unglazed footrim. Wooden stand. (B)
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Jar
description: Short collar neck, round body.  Round low foot.  White background.  Blue Grecian key design on exterior mouthrim.  Blue sacred lotus collar design on shoulder.  Two dragons floating in yellow and green clouds with symbolic fungus and gourds on body.  Star of Shou and sacred lotus in gold.  Cobalt blue wave design.  Three color floral design at base.  Recessed white base with four character mark of Yongzheng. Unglazed footrim.  Wooden stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Bowl
description: Pair of round deep flared bowls with round low foot. Interior with imperial yellow glaze with green enamelled center circle with seal style character "shou" engraved in bottom. Exterior yellow glaze with enamelled Imperial Dragons and Imperial Phoenix birds with sacred flames and clouds. Stylized green enamelled design on base. Yellow low foot. Recessed base with white glaze. Six character mark of Kangxi in blue within double blue ring. Unglazed footrim. Wooden stand. (B).
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Print
description: One of a series of popular prints on paper of Chinese deities from peasant cults. These types of prints go by many names including Beijing Paper Gods (北京紙馬), paper horse (zhima 紙馬), god horse (shenma 神馬), holy sacrifice (shenma 神禡), and armoured horse (jiama 甲馬). This print depicts Lishi Zaxi Xianguan (利市 迊喜 仙官), Spirit Ruler of Favorable Markets, who brings success in business.
credit_line: Gift of Richard Shoemaker, 1951

title: Coin
description: Obv. 咸豐通寶 Xian Feng Tong Bao. Rev. Nan (Manchu) left and 南 Nan right. The reverse is unusual which most likely makes this a charm. Coins with this reverse from the Kangxi period were minted in Changsha, Hunan province with 康熙通寶 Kang Xi Tong Bao on the obverse. This could also be a 诗钱 shi qian "poem coin" or a 套子钱 taozi qian "set coin".
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Print
description: Page from a Chinese book printed by a gaming house detailing procedures to be used for gambling on the outcome of the 1843 civil service exam. This form of gambling on the surnames of exam candidates, known as wei xing 闈姓 “palace gate surnames”, was popular during the late Qing period in regions of south China including Canton, Macao, and Hong Kong. Betting was run by private companies who issued their own certificates, printed lists of winning names, and produced other documentation such as this book of procedures.
