title: Painting
description: Painting of a wisdom king known as vidyaraja in sanskrit based on an inscription on the left hand side which starts 明王. The rest of the characters on illegible.  Possibly Vajrayaksa, the devourer of demons, as he stands on three demons.  The painting could also depict a lokapala, one of the four heavenly kings, possibly Vaisravana as he holds a pagoda. The figure has three heads, green skin, and six arms which hold a flower with a book on top, an arrow, a stupa, and a bow. The two central hands may be in a bhutadamara mudra or the vajrahumkara mudra.  There is a seated figure at the top holding a flower.
credit_line: Gift of Wilson Eyre, Jr., 1919

title: Offering
description: Cluster of orange, blue, black, yellow, and green spheres on golden rectangular base. Each sphere has bronze flower at center secured by nail. One green leaf sticks out center over base on one side. Sticker: made in china. Location: 2nd tier central shrine, left of elephant, leaf pointing to elephant #17
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Scabbard
description: Sheath of copper and characteristic sharkskin with slightly upturned end;  engraved and relief scroll and floral decoration at both ends of obverse.  Embossed design is characteristically Mongolian.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Model
description: Flowers in light green jade pot. 13 ivory flowers, blue beads attached to center of each with wire, green leaves. Stones and red beads in pot. Pot decoration in red, pink, green with gold detail; pointed shapes with rounded bottoms with little red diamond shapes in between each. Location: 2nd tier sits on jade plate #15 flower right of center.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Box
description: Ornate metal box with small Buddha inside. Flat bottom; top curves to point. Relatively plain except for front. Glass over a small front opening. Frontal design motifs: fish, flowers, and other shapes. Over window: 4 leaf like shapes stick up. 2 handles on each side. Etched pattern on back. Location: 1st tier left behind bubbles
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Model
description: 16 ivory flowers with blue-green glass beads in center of each, attached by wire. Stems wuth green leaves go into base. Base: jade pot, light green with stones in it. Design on base: pink, green, red paint with gold detail. Small red diamond shapes between each larger shape. Bottom of pot is a darker green.  Location: 2nd tier left of center plate sits on jade plate #14
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Model
description: Flowers in pot. Seven open flowers, three buds, nine leaves tiled together with wire. Stem wrapped with string. Pot painted gold, cream, red, light & dark green. "Made in China" sticker on bottom. Location: 2nd tier #12/13 sits on cloisonne base
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Dagger
description: Dagger.  Knife has single edged steel blade with prominent blood gutters; end of knife extended through handle which is white bone on one side, black yak horn on back; iron binding over end.  Hilt form is non-Tibetan form.  Embossed design is characteristically Mongolian.  Blade maybe cut down from a bayonette, the bayonette being non-traditionally Asian such as European, Russian or Chinese military issue.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Offering
description: Cluster of orange, green, yellow, blue and blue black spheres on golden rectangular base. Each sphere has a bronze flower at center secured by nail. Blue ball has no nail. credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Model

credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

description: Wooden holder with brocade strip and gilt bronze fittings. Probably functioned as a tool to smooth wrinkles out of clothing or scrolls. Crack in wood.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Stand
description: Wooden stand for a vase with a round open mouth, sloped round shoulders with long waisted body flaring into wider round body tapering to round base.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Sherd
description: Grey stoneware sherd with green crackled celadon glaze. Two pieces fit together. Probably Song.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Sherd
description: Grey stoneware sherd with green crackled celadon glaze. Two pieces fit together. Probably Song.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Figurine
description: A female figure with a monkey in nephrite jade in an off-white color with stand. Originally, probably a belt toggle.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A small jadeite (a) bottle representing a ho-pao (Manchu-style purse) with a coral (b) stopper. Fine.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Tube
description: Two matching ivory tubes possibly scroll ends? One has the numbers 600-402 on sticker inside. Both have remnants of glue on the inside.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A plain squared off-white nephrite (a) bottle with a silver scoop and coral (b) top.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Buckle
description: A white nephrite jade belt buckle in two parts decorated with reticulated chih dragons. There is some chipping on edges.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Buckle
description: A white nephrite jade belt buckle in two parts decorated with reticulated chih dragons. There is some chipping on edges.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Tube
description: Two matching ivory tubes possibly scroll ends? One has the numbers 600-402 on sticker inside. Both have remnants of glue on the inside.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Vase
description: Brass vase with carved design on the side. Two Chinese characters on the bottom. The same letters on 92-1-130. Found in Asian section with no number.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Urn Lid
description: A gray chalcedony (a) urn with self ring handles, incised archaic taotie mask and leaves. The (b) cover has a lion finial.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Urn
description: A gray chalcedony (a) urn with self ring handles, incised archaic taotie mask and leaves. The (b) cover has a lion finial.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Box
description: An agate (a) coupe in a four lobed design with a fitted wooden (b) stand. It also has a fitted blue (c) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vessel
description: An agate (a) coupe in a four lobed design with a fitted wooden (b) stand. It also has a fitted blue (c) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Table Screen
description: A small reticulated nephrite table (a) screen and fitted wooden (b) stand. The decoration of the screen if a flying manchurian crane.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A white nephrite melon shaped bottle with raised designs of melons, leaves and a butterfly. The foot is designed to show a sheng jewel (symbol of success).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A melon shaped white nephrite (a) bottle with raised work of melons, leaves and a bug. The top (b) is rose quartz.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A melon form white and green jade (a) bottle with green jadeite (b) stopper. It represents a melon with surrounding vines, melon leaves and tendrils and a spider.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A rose quartz (a) bottle and (b) stopper. The bottle has a peony flower motif. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. It is a good piece.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A Mongolian snuff bottle made of Lake Baikal nephrite. It has a Mongolian silver scoop and top with an inlay of coral and turquoise.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Thumb Ring
description: Jadeite thumb ring. Fei cui with a hint of lavender. It has a raised Chih Lung (dragon) and cloud. (Very late, 20th century style of chih dragon.)
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Plate
description: A tray made of brass. Carved design, same as the one of 92-1-130, on the plate. Two Chinese characters same as 92-1-130, 131, and 275, on the bottom of the plate.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Case
description: Brass case (A) with a cover (B). Carved design on the cover, and two Chinese characters on the bottom of the case. Same letters on 92-1-131. Found in Asian storage with no number.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A Mongolian snuff bottle made of Lake Baikal nephrite. It has a Mongolian silver scoop and top with an inlay of coral and turquoise.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Pendant
description: A jadeite pendant, light apple green, with flowering plum branches, and a magpie (highly stylized) in relief. Symbols of springtime (or rejuvenation in old age). It has a white gold bale.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A melon form white and green jade (a) bottle with green jadeite (b) stopper. It represents a melon with surrounding vines, melon leaves and tendrils and a spider.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Gong Mallet Handle
description: Yunbo 雲鑮 or Yunluo 雲鑼 mallets.  One is possibly the Yunbo 雲鎛 gong mallet with a missing head. The other is a large wooden brushlike mallet, the wrapped handle of which is unraveling slightly.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A peking glass smoky inside painted bottle (a). The subjects represent a black bird and blossoms along with flowers and an insect. It is signed. It has a coral top (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: A miniature meiping blue and white vase (a) with red shading. Two immortals on clouds appearing as a vision to a fisherman. Possibly a snuff bottle. It has a fitted wooden stand (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: An off-white jade cup with 2 chih-lungs climbing into the (a) cup. It is well carved. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand. It has a fitted, padded, blue box (c)
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase Stand
description: An off-white jade cup with 2 chih-lungs climbing into the (a) cup. It is well carved. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand. It has a fitted, padded, blue box (c)
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A rare and unusual Peking glass nine color overlay on snowflake base bottle (A). The eight overlay colors represent the eight Buddhist symbols. The top (B) is a fine green jadeite.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: An off-white jade cup with 2 chih-lungs climbing into the (a) cup. It is well carved. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand. It has a fitted, padded, blue box (c)
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: A nephrite off-white vase with mock archaic taotie (monster) masks and scroll handles. This is very much in the archaic bronze form. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Lock
description: Bar padlock and long brass key to fit it. One end of the lock has an impressed inscription of three characters, "Great Arising Virtue," possibly the name of the maker, or of the hall or storehouse locked with it.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Anton S. Lau, 1948

title: Inkstand
description: Nephrite jade (a) ink rest for the scholar's table with a dragon among clouds and two characters meaning "joy", also two symbols for success (shing). It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Lid
description: A jadeite water dropper (A) in a melon shape. The color is pale green with darker green and orange on a bud. The stopper (B) is orange representing a squirrel. It has a fitted wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A reverse glass painted bottle (a) of figures in a scholar's study. Reverse: a man observing a dog or wolf which has been hung from a tree. The stopper (b) is a pale yellow.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Ink
description: A fine green and white jadeite (A) seal with raised (Yang) calligraphy, together with (B) vermillion "ink" in a case. The seal is not especially well carved on top, but the inscription is superbly done.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Inkstand
description: Nephrite jade (a) ink rest for the scholar's table with a dragon among clouds and two characters meaning "joy", also two symbols for success (shing). It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Water Vessel
description: A jadeite water dropper (A) in a melon shape. The color is pale green with darker green and orange on a bud. The stopper (B) is orange representing a squirrel. It has a fitted wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: A blue and whtie miniature vase with a stand. The theme on the vase (a) is of a scholar and ladies and a screen. There is a four character Yongzheng mark. It has a fitted wooden stand (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: A small brass vase with a long neck. The top part has carved design of leaves or flower petals. The middle part also has carved design of bamboo leaves. Two Chinese characters, same as 92-1-130, 131, and 276, on the bottom of the vase.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Buckle
description: A belt buckle is the form of a horse rolling over, carved from a nephrite pebble with sking. The piece is too heavy to be a real buckle, instead a collector's item for Chinese scholars. There is a chip on the buckle.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Table Screen
description: A tall, narrow, steatite panel with a lion and crude cut on the top, and incised calligraphy, with a faked seal below. Actually this was a divider between two large seals in a familiar form of table set (3 pieces).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A white glass inside painted bottle (a) with overlay of red glass. One side has a hill and valley landscape with a poem, and the other side is a painting of a cricket eating a cabbage and a butterfly. The stopper (b) is made of agate.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A white jadeite (a) bottle in a bottle gourd shape with a replaced carved nephrite (b) top. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. The top does not belong and appears to be a piece broken off from something else of an inferior material.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A white jadeite (a) bottle in a bottle gourd shape with a replaced carved nephrite (b) top. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. The top does not belong and appears to be a piece broken off from something else of an inferior material.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: An unusual overlay and inside painted bottle (a) whose decoration is swallows flying over a leafless tree (in winter) with plum blossoms (below) heralding the approach of spring. The red overlay covers the top and base. The bottle has cracks. Fake coral (dyed bone) on stopper (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Violin
description: Ssu-hsien-hu-ch'in. Four stringed fiddle no longer used. Dark wood with small rectangular body and rounded sides. Long neck. Peg box curves back. Four tapering hexagonal pegs. Poor condition. One side of body is missing as are two pegs, all strings and the top of peg box. Neck is loose from body.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: An "old" pendant bored out to resemble a snuff (A) bottle, although it could never serve as one because snuff would spill through the pendant hole. Glass counterfeiting archaic jade. An amethyst pendant from a "mandarin chain" serving as a (B) stopper. It has a wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: Exterior in cloisonne technique. Flaring base, tall ovoid body, tall neck with conave curve. Band of copper forms base, junctures of base to body and body to neck, and rim. Decoration on foot is floral design; on body are two confronting dragons nd on neck is floral pattern. Enameling in black (background), turquoise blue, green,  yellow, white and red. Excellent state of preservation.
credit_line: Gift of Winifred Thomas, 1981

title: Censer
description: A gold-stone three legged (a) incense burner with dragon masks. The two handles have free rings cut from the same stone. The (b) cover has three free cut rings and in the center of the cover is alion and a ball. It is setted on a fitted wooden (c) stand. It also has a fitted wooden (d) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Censer
description: A gold-stone three legged (a) incense burner with dragon masks. The two handles have free rings cut from the same stone. The (b) cover has three free cut rings and in the center of the cover is alion and a ball. It is setted on a fitted wooden (c) stand. It also has a fitted wooden (d) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Censer
description: A gold-stone three legged (a) incense burner with dragon masks. The two handles have free rings cut from the same stone. The (b) cover has three free cut rings and in the center of the cover is alion and a ball. It is setted on a fitted wooden (c) stand. It also has a fitted wooden (d) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vase
description: A rock crystal (A) vase with (B) cover and ring handles with a fitted wooden (C) stand. There is a lion finial on the cover. The vase is surrounded by a reticulated manchurian crane and lotus. Qilin (mythical beast) breathing out vapor. On the obverse there is a phoenix. Lion heads with protruding tongues on the vases shoulders.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Censer
description: A gold-stone three legged (a) incense burner with dragon masks. The two handles have free rings cut from the same stone. The (b) cover has three free cut rings and in the center of the cover is alion and a ball. It is setted on a fitted wooden (c) stand. It also has a fitted wooden (d) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: A soft paste blue and white cylindrical bottle (a) with a lotus scroll motif. Has a Qianlong mark (1735 - 1796 CE). It has a fitted wooden stand (b). This type was originally used for containing medicine, and later adopted for snuff bottles. The mark is not reliable for dating, but the type is characteristic of the 18th Century.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Guitar
description: Yuen-ham. Played together with pipa or san-hsien. Wooden octagonal-shaped body. Four pegs two on each side of peg box. Carved wooden crest on top of peg box. Ten frets on neck and one on body. Two carved wooden designs on body. Poor condition. Part of body is detached, badly cracked elsewhere. Bridge and tail piece are detached. Two strings and ten frets are missing.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A green and brown jadeite double (a) bottle in the form of two melons. Each melon forms a separate container with its own (b) and (c) stopper in the shape of butterflies. The brown is part of the outer rind of the original pebble. Double bottles for two kinds of snuff were late, and these seem to be purely ornamental.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A green and brown jadeite double (a) bottle in the form of two melons. Each melon forms a separate container with its own (b) and (c) stopper in the shape of butterflies. The brown is part of the outer rind of the original pebble. Double bottles for two kinds of snuff were late, and these seem to be purely ornamental.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A green and brown jadeite double (a) bottle in the form of two melons. Each melon forms a separate container with its own (b) and (c) stopper in the shape of butterflies. The brown is part of the outer rind of the original pebble. Double bottles for two kinds of snuff were late, and these seem to be purely ornamental.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A very fine snow flake glass with blue overlay. The motif is of  Li Tieguai  ( a Daoist Immortal ) holding a gourd, the vapor from the which produces a mirage of a pavillion; the moon on a cloud; a flying bat; a flying paradise catcher. Reverse: a tree with a flying feng-huang bird. Below it a dog chases a rabbit. Lion birds with wings on shoulders.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Lute Fragments
description: Hah-yiu-ch'in. Eight notes, little used, originated in 1880, twenty strings, rectangular in shape, light wood, convex top, hollow interior, flat bottom with round hole one third of the way from end. Small crescent like hole one third way from other hole. Twenty small flat metal pegs extend from on end, other end has large clover leaf hole. Red paper strips with Chinese characters extend width of sound baord and are near the other end. Rattling agent in side.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Lid
description: A rosewood (hung-mu) (C) box with inset of nephrite jade and a (d) lid. Inside the box are a pair of seals made of steatite in the form of horned lions with cubs. The (b) raised seal has nicer calligraphy than the (a) incised seal. The decoration includes a child offering a peach to the sun-god, Lu-hsing, who is pointing at the sun among the clouds. In upper right corner is a bat of happiness, below it is a deer and at the bottom a symbolic fungus.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Horse Trapping
description: Stitched leather strap (double thickness) with brass studs (47 on belt part), a few missing. Silver buckle (3cm x 4cm) on one end and two holes for buckle at the other end. One repaired section of strap sewn back together. Two shorter leather straps are stitched onto the belt. They are 18 cm long and are looped through a hole in 6cm x 8cm piece of white shell. One shell has 2 other small holes. Brass strip over leather looped through shell.
credit_line: Academy of Natural Sciences / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Statue
description: Wooden statuette of male figure, possibly a temple image of the war god. Figure wears high cap with back flaps, a robe and tunic, and stands on domed surface with cloud-like formations carved in relief. Five clumps of horse hair comprise beard. Right arm is raised and bent with fist clenched and pierced for attachment of attribute (now missing) and left arm is raised and bent toward body with index and forefinger pointing toward right hand. Left fist is pierced for insertion of rod. Dark brown and black paint covers surface, black used for details such as sections of tunic. Wide crack down back left side. Back of cap and right hand flaking.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Carol E. Dickey, 1981

title: China Fragments
provenience: Alaska | Yakutat Bay | Lost River Site
credit_line: Survey of Northern Tlingit Country, Frederica de Laguna, 1989

title: Flute
description: Dizi. Flute.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Bull, 1984

title: Drum
description: Large rattle hand drum (na-ch'un or damaru) with designs painted on the body with a red cloth attached. Cloth case for the drum is 22050B.
credit_line: Gift of William Henry Furness 3rd, Alfred Craven Harrison Jr. and Hiram M. Hiller, 1900

title: Bowl
description: Used by common people. Dark polished wood; beautiful graining. Disc base, lower sides slightly rounded, upper slightly concave to "rolled rim."
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Box
description: Box for 65-2-1A.
credit_line: Exchange with the Rockhill Nelson Gallery, 1965

title: Prayer Roll (uncertain)
description: Six prayer rolls. Unrolled to varying degrees. White paper with red script.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Prayer Roll
description: Two scrolls (unraveled). Probably prayer rolls taken from statues and prayer wheels. Bluish-black paper with gold script.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Prayer Roll (uncertain)
description: Somewhat unrolled scroll. White paper with black script.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Prayer Roll (uncertain)
description: Partially unrolled and crushed. White paper with black script.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Jug
description: Peach-shaped copper jug for pouring wine. Filled from bottom which has removable lid. Strap handle opposite high delicate spout. The peach is the symbol of long life; wine is supposed to give long life.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Bowl
description: Used by lamas in monastery chanting hall. Wood. Disc base, hemispherical body, carination below short neck, "rolled" rim.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Prayer Roll
description: Two scrolls. Dark blue paper with red and gold script. One of the two is tied with string.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Seal (Object)
description: Brass cone shaped stamp with circular and rectangular design on base.
credit_line: Gift of Jesse H. Holmes, Jr., 1973

title: Prayer Roll (uncertain)
description: Partially unrolled and crushed. White with black script.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Paper
description: Poor condition. Piece of paper with two circular designs. Circle is divided into rings with sort of flower design at its center. Script covers much of the inner spaces.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Prayer Roll
description: 33 scrolls. Script appears to be written in red. Tag found with them said "Tibetan prayers and blessings taken from inside statues and prayer wheels" Sealed 4-10-76 AS.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Butter Lamp
description: Brass lamp for burning butter.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1985

description: Small. With clapper; ring on top.

title: Lamp Stand
description: Tang shu. Lamp stand.  Pewter.  Company name Li Ho Zao.
credit_line: Gift of Dr. W. W. McClure, 1892

title: Axe
description: Axe with silk cord.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Morgan Wing on behalf of the Estate of Florence C. Whitney, 1942

title: Drum Hammer
description: Stick is carved wood with cloth head. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Earring
description: Jade ear ring.  Grey nephrite or jadeite.
credit_line: Purchased from Rev. Edward W. Thwing; subscription of Robert C. H. Brock, 1902

title: Oboe
description: Wood, metal bell at end, 7 frontal holes, 1 dorsal hole. No mouthpiece.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1984

title: Medicine
description: Ling shik hai. (靈石蟹) "Efficacious stone crabs".
credit_line: Gift of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 1997

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Violin
description: Tag indicated that this instrument is a Hu-ch'ia. Wooden, long and slender.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1988

title: Arrow
description: One of eleven arrows.  Cane shaft, painted at both ends, small iron head, feathered, notched.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Axe Head
description: Yellowish jade axe or archaistic form Double band of squared scrolls. Date uncertain.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Anton S. Lau, 1948

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A pink opaque glass bottle (a) with a rose quartz stopper (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Flute
description: Ti. Child's toy, bamboo flute, six finger holes. Painted red, with black ring at bottom. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Box
description: Walrus ivory dyed green; oval with flat base and sides; lid fits over interior rim.
credit_line: Gift of Stephen D. Pyle, 1954

title: Seal (Object)
description: Yellow brown seal carved on all sides with a landscape. Name seal on bottom.
credit_line: Gift of James K. Gamble Jr., 1970

title: Stand
description: A gold fish (a) made of rock crystal with a wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A pink opaque glass bottle (a) with a rose quartz stopper (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Box Lid
description: Walrus ivory dyed green; oval with flat base and sides; lid fits over interior rim.
credit_line: Gift of Stephen D. Pyle, 1954

title: Wine Cup
description: Brass.  Hemispherical with concave base;  overhanging rim
credit_line: Academy of Natural Science / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Stand
description: Stand for a cup with a wide flared mouth tapering to a round indented base with a low foot.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Stand
description: Double gourd-shaped, decorated with double asters and formal foliage in brilliant blue on a white background. Perfect condition (1914).
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Stand
description: Wooden stand for a bowl with a round, flared, deep body with rolled lip and small round foot.
credit_line: Bequest of Robert C. Alexander, 1988

title: Base
description: Double gourd-shaped, decorated with double asters and formal foliage in brilliant blue on a white background. Perfect condition (1914).
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Wine Cup
description: Brass.  Hemispherical with concave base.  overhanging rim
credit_line: Academy of Natural Science / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Bowl
description: a) White nephrite jade bowl with Ch'ien-lung (probably later) mark with (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Chopstick
description: One chopstick--pair with 42-30-239C.  Polished bone
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Morgan Wing on behalf of the Estate of Florence C. Whitney, 1942

title: Chopstick
description: One chopstick--pair with 42-30-239C.  Polished bone.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Morgan Wing on behalf of the Estate of Florence C. Whitney, 1942

title: Sherd
description: White stoneware sherd with white glaze and blue design. Ming.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A snuff bottle (a) of canary yellow glass with a fake coral top (b). Good.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Ring
description: Tan jade or stone, partly decompsed. Perferated ring with center rim raised on both sides. No design.
credit_line: Gift of James K. Gamble Jr., 1970

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A snuff bottle (a) of canary yellow glass with a fake coral top (b). Good.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Bowl
description: Mottled green and white bowl. Very thin, polished, plain bowl with slightly flaring sides. Ring base. Has teakwood stand.
credit_line: Bequest of Mrs. Frances E. (Harry) Markoe, 1943

title: Book Mark
description: Thin flat jade book mark.  Coin and tassel attached but numbered as 81-23-38B.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A plain white nephrite bottle (a) and half a glass bead (imitating coral) on the (b) stopper.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A plain white nephrite bottle with a red peking glass (B) top and green glass finial.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A plain white nephrite bottle with a red peking glass (B) top and green glass finial.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: An oval banded carnelian snuff bottle (a) with a lapis lazuli top (b) and flattened foot. Good.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: An oval banded carnelian snuff bottle (a) with a lapis lazuli top (b) and flattened foot. Good.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A plain white nephrite bottle (a) and half a glass bead (imitating coral) on the (b) stopper.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Carving
description: A pebble nephrite jade carving representing the moon rising among clouds, behind a boulder from which springs a flowering plum tree.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Base
description: A nephrite jade, celadon color, combination vase (A) decorated in datura flowers, fungi (lingzhi) and a fruit. It has a fitted (B) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Flute
description: Cheng-ti. Bamboo, wood tipped, decorated with thread bands, nine frontal stops arranged one, six, two. Two dorsal stops, side by side. One large crack.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Paper
description: Scroll with dragon in silver on a yellow background surrounded by clouds. There is a border going around the piece made of vines and flowers. The back has auspicious symbols. A label in french says that it is paper for a diploma for a Mandarin which was presented by Mr. Puginier. This is likely Paul-François Puginier (1835-1892) a Bishop who worked in Hanoi, Vietnam from 1859-1892. There is a handwriting on it that says "Pattern of a Dragon Indo China'.
credit_line: Gift of the Philadelphia Commercial Museum (also known as the Philadelphia Civic Center Museum), Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, 2003

title: Base
description: A small reticulated nephrite table (a) screen and fitted wooden (b) stand. The decoration of the screen if a flying manchurian crane.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Clapper
description: Paiban 拍板. Wooden clapper. Two slats. Used in modern traidiontal orchestras and opera performances. Darkwood, tied with green string, slight ridge down center of each clapper. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Vase
description: A nephrite jade, celadon color, combination vase (A) decorated in datura flowers, fungi (lingzhi) and a fruit. It has a fitted (B) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Base
description: An agate (a) coupe in a four lobed design with a fitted wooden (b) stand. It also has a fitted blue (c) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A melon shaped white nephrite (a) bottle with raised work of melons, leaves and a bug. The top (b) is rose quartz.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Sword Sheath
description: Covered with black leather; iron band at top and tip and two iron rings on upper half connected by ornamental bar
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Morgan Wing on behalf of the Estate of Florence C. Whitney, 1942

title: Base
description: One of a pair of cocks carved from jadeite jade with fitted wooden (B) stand. The jade (A) cock is a dull green and yellow color.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Medicine Bottle
description: Small glass bottle, rectangular in shape but slightly wider at top. Top is plugged with brown stopper. Bottle is 3/4 full of red sand. See: 92-1-206, 208.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Figurine
description: One of a pair of cocks carved from jadeite jade with fitted wooden (B) stand. The jade (A) cock is a dull green and yellow color.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Figurine
description: A seated Budai (a Chinese monk, often miscalled a Buddha) holding a lotus seed pod, instead of his traditional sack (which makes a pun of his name).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: A rose quartz (a) bottle and (b) stopper. The bottle has a peony flower motif. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. It is a good piece.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Clapper
description: Paiban 拍板. Wooden clapper. Three slats. Used in modern traditional orchestras and opera performances. Tied together, somewhat rectangular. Joined by gold string. Good condition except for a number of gouges and scratches.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A rare snuff bottle (a) of "vermicelli agate". There are lion masks on the shoulders of the bottle. The top (b) is a good piece of green jadeite.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Figurine
description: Nephrite reclining horse. The carving is poorly detailed. An amulet for someone who was born in "the year of the horse". The jade is an off-white color.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A clear glass (a) snuff bottle with red overlay in a peach design. There are very crude "masks" on the shoulders. The stopper (b) is coral.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Amulet (uncertain)
description: One of four nearly identical pendants or amulets. Rectangular hole at top.  Blue string attached approximately 7.0 cm long.  Iniscription says chang-ming, long-life and fu-kuci, prosperous.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A rare snuff bottle (a) of "vermicelli agate". There are lion masks on the shoulders of the bottle. The top (b) is a good piece of green jadeite.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Figurine
description: A carving of a small crab that is hiding in a lotus leaf. The piece is made from pale green nephrite jade pebble with some skin. Very well made.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A rose quartz (a) bottle and (b) stopper. The bottle has a peony flower motif. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. It is a good piece.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Pendant
description: An off-white nephrite jade pendant. The motif massed clouds. A red cord with a carnelian bead is strung through the hole at one end.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Lid
description: A carnelian vase-shaped (a) bottle with a (b) top and ivory spoon. The motif is hornless dragons (chih) and flames in relief.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Medicine
description: Brown sticks and bark.  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. There is a label with an illegible number.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Bell
description: Red glass bell with clear crystal clapper.  Top of bell has grey metal cap with gold colored metal hook for suspending bell and inside for suspending clapper.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Bell
description: Red glass bell with clear crystal clapper.  Top of bell has grey metal cap with gold colored metal hook for suspending bell and inside for suspending clapper.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Sword
description: Band around outer edge with straight line is silvered iron.  Woven knot would have been longer but broken off.   Hook and attachment is typical of Chinese influence, for wearing on belt.  Quality of blade is very good.
credit_line: Purchased from Alexander Scott, 1914

title: Medicine
description: Thin strips of light brown bark.  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. There is a label with an illegible number.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Base
description: A nephrite off-white vase with mock archaic taotie (monster) masks and scroll handles. This is very much in the archaic bronze form. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Hooked Trumpet
description: Cha Chiao.  The bell faces the player when blown. Used at weddings and funterals; the performers are sometimes on horseback.  Brass:  3 sections marked by bulging rings; flaring bell; shallow, broad-rimmed mouth piece.  Good Condition
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A reverse glass painted bottle (a) of figures in a scholar's study. Reverse: a man observing a dog or wolf which has been hung from a tree. The stopper (b) is a pale yellow.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Base
description: A jadeite water dropper (A) in a melon shape. The color is pale green with darker green and orange on a bud. The stopper (B) is orange representing a squirrel. It has a fitted wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Medicine
description: Tiny brown roots or branches.  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. There is a label on the jar but the number is partly illegible.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Sword Pommel Mount
description: A nephrite disc with alteration from burial with central swirl motif. Uncarved on reverse side. Very likely a medieval imitation of an earlier type because there is no effective means for attachment.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Seal (Object)
description: A fine green and white jadeite (A) seal with raised (Yang) calligraphy, together with (B) vermillion "ink" in a case. The seal is not especially well carved on top, but the inscription is superbly done.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A miniature meiping blue and white vase (a) with red shading. Two immortals on clouds appearing as a vision to a fisherman. Possibly a snuff bottle. It has a fitted wooden stand (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Medicine
description: Three objects resembling dried mushrooms.  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. There is a small label with a red border that has an illegible number.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Moon Guitar
description: Yueqin, moon guitar. Circular wooden body with eight frets. Additional two frets on neck. Sides and neck are red, the rest is brown. Peg board curves back slightly. Four conical pegs. Poor condition. Cracks in body. Two frets and two strings are missing.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Pendant
description: A chih dragon with a bird's head at the end of its tail. Made of nephrite jade. A red cord with a carnelian bead is strung through the hole at the top end of the pendant. See Collections file for additional information.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Base
description: A white jadeite (a) bottle in a bottle gourd shape with a replaced carved nephrite (b) top. It has a fitted wooden (c) stand. The top does not belong and appears to be a piece broken off from something else of an inferior material.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Ocarina
description: Xun  壎. Held firmly in both hands, globular shape, three holes for fingers, larger hole in top for mouth. Clay, painted red-brown with gold floral designs. Top half broken, not all pieces present. There is a sticker on the bottom that says Xun, along with six other characters.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Stand
description: A blue and white rouleau shaped miniature vase (A) with a fitted wooden stand (B). The motif is of the eighteen luohan (disciples of Buddha). As a kind of puzzle or joke, the eighteenth luohan is under the base. Probably a snuff bottle.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Statue
description: Metal statue of Guanyin on a six legged lotus flower base. The right hand is holding a small ball, the left hand holds a sash which is draped across the back. She is wearing a necklace with red, green, blue & pink glass beads, set in metal.
credit_line: Gift of Joy and Edward Schweizer, 1994

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A blue and white rouleau shaped miniature vase (A) with a fitted wooden stand (B). The motif is of the eighteen luohan (disciples of Buddha). As a kind of puzzle or joke, the eighteenth luohan is under the base. Probably a snuff bottle.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Violin
description: Ssu-hsien. Four stringed tapering, hexagonal pegs, one broken. Hollow slightly hourglass shaped body of dark wood, covered with snakeskin, banded by blue cloths, bottom has carved wooden insert, long neck of dark wood inserted through front part of body. Fair condition. Head slightly warped, body loose from neck, strings missing.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Bracelet
description: Liu ak. Glass wristlet, imitation of jade. Bracelet. Glass or jade. Green. Broken in three places. Jade wristlets are about the only charm worn by the Chinese in the United States. It is said they give strength to the arm, and one that has been recovered from a grave is most highly valued.
credit_line: Deposited by R. Stewart Culin, 1890

title: Snuff Bottle
description: An "old" pendant bored out to resemble a snuff (A) bottle, although it could never serve as one because snuff would spill through the pendant hole. Glass counterfeiting archaic jade. An amethyst pendant from a "mandarin chain" serving as a (B) stopper. It has a wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: An "old" pendant bored out to resemble a snuff (a) bottle, although it could never serve as one because snuff would spill through the pendant hole. Glass counterfeiting archaic jade. An amethyst pendant from a "mandarin chain" serving as a (b) stopper. It has a wooden (C) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Finial
description: Dark wood finial/ornament. General tear-drop shape. Flat circular base with rounded top and small cylindrical protruding from bottom. Tear-drop body with long neck; ribbed body and neck. Small tear drop shape at top. Location: 1st tier left 1st place-above ceramic hanging piece.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Gong
description: Seau-bo. Small, used at theatrical performances. Circular, metal, flat surfaces. Rim almost perpendicular to surface. Similar to A857, but about 2/3 the diameter, and much thicker metal. It is also heavier. Surface has some markings/scratches, and indentations that may indicate it was pounded into this particular shape, but otherwise no writing. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Bowl
description: One of a pair of egg shell porcelain hexagonal bowls with enamel decoration in Ku-Yueh-Hsuan manner. The decoration is of maidens ina garden with a poem. The mark is a four character Chien Lung mark. Border and center panels are blue enamel. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: One of a pair of Fu dogs (64-8-5/6).  Kangxi period.  Green, yellow, black on bases decorated with flowers.  Bodies covered with a rich green enamel, the manes and tail in aubergine, the heads with yellow, black, etc.  Supported on oblong bases decorated with red formal flowers and black foliage on a bright green background.  Brilliant quality.  Perfect condition.  Moveable eyes.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Samuel Rotan, 1964

title: Drum
description: Barrel drum. Wood, hollowed out tree trunk. One head made of skin. Stretched into a bell shape with holes around the rim. The head is held on by two rows of large nails. Four metal rings are on the sides. Three reed rings encircle the base. Chinese characters in black are on the body. Some reeds broken, wood chipped, head cracked.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Base
description: One of a pair of egg shell porcelain hexagonal (a) bowls with enamel decoration in Ku-Yueh-Husan manner. The decoration is of maidens ina garden with a poem. The mark is a four character Chien Lung mark. Border and center panels are blue enamel with delicate dragon in blue on bottom of bowl (inside). It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Stand
description: A covered (A) vase of jadeite. An immortal (hsui nu) and a dragon in relief on the surface. Another dragon is on the lid. The dragon on the lid has some characteristics of Japanese dragons. The one on the side is a misunderstood Chinese chih dragon. The misunderstandings indicate a non-Asian origin. It has a fitted wooden (B) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A double gourd shaped coral (a) bottle with an excellent raised carved design of Li Tieguai holding a gourd from which emmanates a vapor containing a happiness bat. The gourd vine adds the idea of abundance of happiness. Originally the top was the upper part of the gourd in coral, the jade (b) top doesn't match.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Ornament
description: A nephrite mountain. (a) The decoration is the peaches of immortality growing on a cloud-capped mountain. A boatman, holding an oar, has picked one and is returning to his boat (under a ledge). The reverse side has a grotto. The mountain is carved from a natural pebble and has some skin left intact. It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Moon Guitar
description: Yueqin of redwood. Circular body, short neck, curving peg box, four pegs ( two on each side), two frets on neck, seven pair of smaller frets on body, one small single fret on body near neck. Frets are of lighter wood than neck, metal vibrator in body. Semicircular raised string holder on body. All pegs and the decorative piece above box are missing. Cracks in body.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Carving
description: A white nephrite jade panel taken from a jui-i scepter with raised and incised work. The pattern shows two peaches, two spiders, two sheng jewels (often miscalled cash) with silk scarfs, and a stylized bat (head below with out stretched wings). Very well carved. There is an inset of carnelian in the center with a shou character. Now seated in an Occidental wooden stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Horse Trapping
description: Long leather belt, double thickness stiched together. 32 round brass studs, some missing. Leather repaired and sewn back together. Large leather stitches (Hold studs on?). Slits in leather at one end for buckle. Simple silver buckle held on by twisted leather ring at the end of belt, reinforced by small metal plate. Has label: "133." which corresponds to "just plain 133 - harness trapping".
credit_line: Academy of Natural Sciences / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Cymbal
description: Pengling 碰鈴. One of two finger cymbals, missing its mate. Small cymbals hit against each other. Each cymbal has a center hole through which a string can be thread. The central boss has residue of different metal on it. Small, round metal flat rim with convex center.  Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Ink Stick
description: Black rectangular stick of ink with gold chinese characters impressed on one side and gold tree branch and green chinese characters impressed on the other side. Broken in half. Lacquered cylindrical box with lid. Inside and outside are lacquered in black with gold designs on swirling patterns and circles on out side and top of box. Bottom has label with Burmese script on it. Probably mid-20th century. Made in Pagan.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Rope
description: One of two pieces of rope made out of horse hair. Dark brown and beige hair braided together to make pattern. Both ropes are frayed in many places. Rope A is thicker and in better condition. There is a knotted loop in the end. Rope B has been repaired, with light brown yarn wrapped around rope to keep it together. It has piece of leather 11cm x 4 cm with small holes.
credit_line: Academy of Natural Sciences / University Museum Expedition to Southwest China and Tibet; Gordon T. Bowles, 1932

title: Ink Stick
description: Black rectangular stick of ink with gold chinese characters impressed on one side and gold tree branch and green chinese characters impressed on the other side. Broken in half. Lacquered cylindrical box with lid. Inside and outside are lacquered in black with gold designs on swirling patterns and circles on out side and top of box. Bottom has label with Burmese script on it. Probably mid-20th century. Made in Pagan.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Trumpet
description: Suona 嗩吶. Missing its reed. Wood and brass. Double Reed Instrument. Similar to the western Oboe. Dissintegrating tab, part of  a red sticker on the inner edge of the bell which has fallen off.  It seems to  indicate county and city but is illegable. The remaining part, still glued onto the bell says: "Made at the Bright Sound shop" (明聲館造). In modern times, these are often used in orchestras and funerary processions. Brass mouthpiece: stem disc, two spherical bulges disc. Brass bell, seven frontal holes, each in its own groove carved around slender conical pipe: one hole at back. Bell bent.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Theatrical Cymbal
description: Used in theatrical performances, processions, etc. Thin, metal, circular, slightly concave rim, convex surface with raised boss in the center. Leather handles through hole in center of boss.  Part of a set with A863A, this one has 斯 (is, " this") written on the outer surface in black ink. The two black ink phrases on the inner surface. The first one reads: 金關中市，西義豐號 (something about the place of manufacture, most likely). The second phrase is 響器出門，概不退換 ("Once the percussion instrument has gone out the door, there are generally no refunds or returns"). Metal broken at boss.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Seal (Object)
description: A rosewood (hung-mu) (C) box with inset of nephrite jade and a (d) lid. Inside the box are a pair of seals made of steatite in the form of horned lions with cubs. The (b) raised seal has nicer calligraphy than the (a) incised seal. The decoration includes a child offering a peach to the sun-god, Lu-hsing, who is pointing at the sun among the clouds. In upper right corner is a bat of happiness, below it is a deer and at the bottom a symbolic fungus.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Seal Box
description: A rosewood (hung-mu) (C) box with inset of nephrite jade and a (d) lid. Inside the box are a pair of seals made of steatite in the form of horned lions with cubs. The (b) raised seal has nicer calligraphy than the (a) incised seal. The decoration includes a child offering a peach to the sun-god, Lu-hsing, who is pointing at the sun among the clouds. In upper right corner is a bat of happiness, below it is a deer and at the bottom a symbolic fungus.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Theatrical Cymbal
description: Bo 鈸. Used in theatrical performances, processions, etc. Thin, metal, circular, slightly concave rim, convex surface with raised boss in the center. Leather handles through hole in center of boss.  There are two in the set, played by crashing the inner faces against each other. There is a leather strap through the center of each - the player should stick their hands through these. This one has 和 or 扣 (he/kou, "harmony/smash") written on three outer surface in black ink. On the inner surface, the number 34 is written in red ink, and there are two phrases in black ink: these one on the right is difficult to make out but might be 金關中市，西義豐號 (something about the place of manufacture, most likely). The second phrase is 響器出門，概不退換 ("Once the percussion instrument has gone out the door, there are generally no refunds or returns").  Metal broken at boss.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Medicine

title: Tsamba Box Lid
description: Circular Tsamba box.  Cylindrical box with flat base.  Cover, which fits inside mouth of box, in 3 steps, the top one a flat disc.  Shows use of primitive lathe for hollowing.  Painting characteristic of East Tibetans;  rather brash colors; red with some black, blue, yellow, orange, green;  Chinese 'shou' used as good luck charms(2 long ones and 2 half round ones).

description: "Strike-a-light". Green leather case, iron mountings with insets of filigree gold. The insets in the iron "shoe" at the bottom make this a great rarity. These latter are carved to represent a pair of kuilong dragons, flanking a Shou character (Longevity)

title: Ornament
description: Charm box square brass set with turquoises thickly (covered). Hollow metal case which does not open. Case is square with four leaves which extend beyond top of box at each side below which there are four loops of various sizes. Sides are embossed. Top is almost entirely filled by turquoise inlay in petal-like and square patterns. Back is silver in color and plain metal. Rest of case is a gold-colored metal.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Tsamba Box
description: Circular Tsamba box.  Cylindrical box with flat base.  Cover, which fits inside mouth of box, in 3 steps, the top one a flat disc.  Shows use of primitive lathe for hollowing. title: Cymbal
description: Xiaobo 小鈸.  Small cymbals hit against each other used by children. The Xiaobo has spread across China among minorities as well as Han Chinese. It is often used in folk opera. Metal, possibly copper, round with slightly concave rim and convex surface with raised boss in the center. Hole in boss, bit of red string attached to one cymbal.  Each cymbal has a center hole through which a string can be thread. Good condition.

title: Belt Hook
description: Miniature bronze belt hook in form of bird with returned head and outstretched wings.  Tip of beak is broken.  Green patination.  Kept in blue cloth fitted case with 81-7-1.
credit_line: Purchased from Sotheby Parke Bernet, 1981

title: Medicine
creator: Unknown
description: Thin strips of black bark.  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. There is a label with an illegible number.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A flat bottom flask shaped glass (a) snuff bottle imitating nephrite with a jadeite (b) stopper. The design consists of small round Shou characters in relief. Worthless.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Carving
description: A nice white nephrite jade reticulated carving of a goose among lotus plants. The carving was once from an insert of a jui scepter. It is now mounted ona wooden (Occidental) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Flute
description: Tuen-ti. Light brown wood flute (cane?); ivory tipped, eight holes on front, two holes offset on back, also one notched hole on back, small hole in center of top ivory piece, bottom ivory tip open. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Gong Stand
description: Do-bachi. Used by Buddhist priest and devotees. Wooden, painted red. Six curved legs, two parallel to the other pair, crossing at the center. Carved decorations near feet and near top square section where legs join. Poor condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A flat bottom flask shaped glass (a) snuff bottle imitating nephrite with a jadeite (b) stopper. The design consists of small round Shou characters in relief. Worthless.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Shrine
description: Wooden base with four square holes in each top corner, 4 smaller rectangular holes equally spaced across top. Stained black with carved design around base: 17 carved bumps with wavy design surrounding each bump
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Trumpet
description: Hao-tung. Used for military purposes. Brass, slightly conical shaft and long bell. Mouthpiece very slightly capped with wide rim, spherical bulge just above bell. Ring at end of bell. Telescoping in two section. Each section has one bulge. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Drum
description: Tung-ku, drum.  Metal.  Used in theaters, processions and on boats as dinner bells. Metal drum with boss in center. Tapering rim. Two holes and suspending rope on one side. Crack through edge of drum.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Drum
description: Tung-ku, drum.  Metal.  Used in theaters, processions and on boats as dinner bells. Metal drum with boss in center. Tapering rim. Two holes and suspending rope on one side. Crack through edge of drum.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Chopstick
description: Pair of ivory chopsticks (A-B)  in an elaborate case (C) of carved wood with heavy silver fittings. The silver is decorated in repousse with dragons, and with incised floral patterns and auspicious characters. Case contains one large empty space, possibly for a knife or pipe.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Chopstick
description: Pair of ivory chopsticks (A-B) in an elaborate case (C) of carved wood with heavy silver fittings. The silver is decorated in repousse with dragons, and with incised floral patterns and auspicious characters. Case contains one large empty space, possibly for a knife or pipe.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Statue
description: Small male figure on oval base wearing necklaces, crown, & flowing scarf. Right hand holds object up in the air, left holds large ring which sticks out from his body. Location: Tier 3, outside shelf; left, middle niche.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Snuff Bottle
description: A nephrite pale green vase shaped (a) bottle with a green glass (b) stopper. The raised motif represents a Daoist sage with a pet deer sitting under a pine tree and a bat (happiness) flying overhead. Below, rocks and low bamboo. Very fine.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Medicine
description: 牛黃. Cow bezoar. A concretion found in the gall bladder of several ruminant animals. A sedative and tonic. From Thailand and Straits. Value at Xiamen, $8 per tael. One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Snuff Bottle Spoon Lid
description: A nephrite pale green vase shaped (a) bottle with a green glass (b) stopper. The raised motif represents a Daoist sage with a pet deer sitting under a pine tree and a bat (happiness) flying overhead. Below, rocks and low bamboo. Very fine.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Vessel
description: Light green vessel with three legs for base, each leg carved.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Fred Maloof (Richard G. and Jennifer L. Maloof), 1994

title: Violin
description: Ti-ch'in. Body of coconut shell with wood soundboard. Underside of body covered out to make a simple rosette-like design. Slender fretless neck passes through body. Neck curves slightly at pegbox. Two lateral pegs. Dark brown color. Good condition. One string broken. Bow and tassel shown in photo are missing.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Oboe
description: Commonly used by orchestras and processions. Mouthpiece, stem: disc, two spherical bulges, disc metal. Wood pipe, seven frontal finger holes, each in its own groove carved around pipe, one hole in back. Pipe is slender and conical. Wide end of wooden tube inserted in conical metal trumpet end with offset ring around its center. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Lute
description: Sanxian. Favorite of street ballad singers. Three strings, small circular body of dark wood, with snakeskin covering both front and back. Long neck of dark wood curving back into scroll above pegs. Three pegs, tapering and hexagonal in shape. Poor condition. Strings missing, wood broken near bottom peg and skins broken on both sides.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Carving
description: A nephrite (a) pebble mountain with skin. The carving on one side is of a Daoist recluse with his disciple. The temple dwelling of the scolar recluse and his disciple is shown on the crag above them. The reverse shows stylized trees above a water fall. Very fine work. It comes with a fitted stand (b).
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Violin Fragment
description: Hu-ch'in. For general household use, particularly in Beijing. Dark wood body is an open-ended hollow cylinder with a snakeskin head covering the closed end and bound by a wide cloth band. Dark wood neck inserted towards front of body. Two tapering bulbous pegs. Played with its accompanying bamboo bow. Good condition but hair is frayed.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Violin
description: Hu-ch'in. For general household use, particularly in Beijing. Dark wood body is an open-ended hollow cylinder with a snakeskin head covering the closed end and bound by a wide cloth band. Dark wood neck inserted towards front of body. Two tapering bulbous pegs. Played with its accompanying bamboo bow. Good condition but hair is frayed.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Violin Bow
description: Hu-ch'in. For general household use, particularly in Beijing. Dark wood body is an open-ended hollow cylinder with a snakeskin head covering the closed end and bound by a wide cloth band. Dark wood neck inserted towards front of body. Two tapering bulbous pegs. Played with its accompanying bamboo bow. Good condition but hair is frayed.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Gong
description: Luo, (小) 鑼 also called 手鑼, hand held Gong. Circular, metal, convex. Wooden mallet is missing. Played by grasping the inner edge of the gong rim in the left hand, while striking the outer surface with a wooden mallet. Hand held gongs exist in different pitches: high, middle, and low. There are Chinese characters on inner surface in black. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Violin Fragment
description: Hu-ch'in. For general household use, particularly in Beijing. Dark wood body is an open-ended hollow cylinder with a snakeskin head covering the closed end and bound by a wide cloth band. Dark wood neck inserted towards front of body. Two tapering bulbous pegs. Played with its accompanying bamboo bow. Good condition but hair is frayed.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Medicine
creator: Unknown
description: 藿香. Betonica officinalis. It is curious to note that this remedy is recommended both in the Herbarium of Apuleius and in the bencao (本草),  the Chinese pharmacopoeia, as a remedy for the effects of drunken debauch. Value at Xiamen (Amoy), $20 per picul. Brown root. One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Chest
description: Export "byokin" black lacquered wooden chest with metal lock/clasp, two hinges and two handles, most likely a tea caddy. Top and sides have intricate landscape scenes in gold with touches of red and green. Landscapes include many figures, buildings and boats. A band of dragons frames the scene on the top of the trunk.  Lockplate marked PATHNT.
credit_line: Gift of the Estate of Elizabeth Lyons, Keeper of the Asian Collections, University Museum, 1989

title: Bowl
description: One of a pair of egg shell porcelain hexagonal (a) bowls with enamel decoration in Ku-Yueh-Husan manner. The decoration is of maidens in a garden with a poem. The mark is a four character Qianlong mark. Border and center panels are blue enamel with delicate dragon in blue on bottom of bowl (inside). It has a fitted wooden (b) stand.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Statue Base
description: A red coral branch that has been carved in the "a) shape of two ladies. Both are standing on the back of a turtle, one is holding a platter and wine ewer the other is holding a moon guitar. The top of the guitar is damaged. There is a fitted (b) stand of green quartz. It also has a fitted wooden (c) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Figurine
description: A red coral branch that has been carved in the "a) shape of two ladies. Both are standing on the back of a turtle, one is holding a platter and wine ewer the other is holding a moon guitar. The top of the guitar is damaged. There is a fitted (b) stand of green quartz. It also has a fitted wooden (c) box.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Lute
description: Pipa. "Balloon guitar". Four strings. Pear-shaped. Body and neck are of one piece. Dark wood with ivory on neck and on string holder. Peg box of lighter wood curving back. Carved bat ornament on top of peg box curving around to front. Four long hexagonal pegs. Poor condition with a large crack in body, ivory missing from neck, string holder detached and three pegs missing. None of the more than twelve frets are present.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Medicine
description: 草菓. Four pieces of nuts and herbs. Seeds on the amomum medium. As a stomachic, to give pungent flavor to spirituous liquors and as a stimulant in ague. Fom Japan. Value at Ningbo, $12 per picul. As  One of a collection of samples of Chinese medicine, each in an individual glass jar sealed with cork top. The label on this jar is different in appearance than the other labels in this collection as it has a red border. This may be because it was imported from Japan.
credit_line: Gift of R. Stewart Culin, pre-1903

title: Gong
description: Due to the placement of the three holes in the rim, it seems to be one in a set of several yunluo ( cloud gongs ). These gongs were pitched by adjusting the thickness of the metal so that they could produce melodies. They are used in Buddhist and Daoist ceremonial music and in procession music. The rest of the ensemble normally consists of sheng (mouth organs), guan (reed pipes, similar to an oboe), and unpitched cymbals and drums. There is an indecipherable black ink marking on the inner face. Unattached from handle which is missing. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Seal (Object)
description: A rosewood (hung-mu) (C) box with inset of nephrite jade and a (d) lid. Inside the box are a pair of seals made of steatite in the form of horned lions with cubs. The (b) raised seal has nicer calligraphy than the (a) incised seal. The decoration includes a child offering a peach to the sun-god, Lu-hsing, who is pointing at the sun among the clouds. In upper right corner is a bat of happiness, below it is a deer and at the bottom a symbolic fungus.
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Paul K. Addams, 1981

title: Figurine
description: Tiny pottery dog.  Amber glaze.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Fan
description: Carved ivory fan
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Lucy Wharton (Joseph) Drexel, 1897

title: Fly Whisk
description: Chinese fly whisk with inlaid handle.
credit_line: Gift of John Getz, 1926

title: Figurine
description: Tiny dog glazed brown color. Fired in kiln.
credit_line: The Chinese Expedition, Carl W. Bishop, 1916

title: Violin
description: Ti-ch'in. Most popular instrument throughout China, coconut body with flat wooden front of dark wood, lighter colored bamboo neck, back of body has five small holes, red paper with Chinese characters on body. Two strings and two pegs. Fair condition. No pegs or strings, bamboo neck cracked.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Bow
description: Tartar bow.  Bamboo, hardwood, sinew, wrappings of fiber and rattan.
credit_line: Gift of William H. Miller, 1916

title: Ear Pick
description: Ear pick set.
credit_line: Gift of William Pepper, 1898

title: Print
description: Fragments of Tibetan print.  With Tibetan script, framed by a tiger in two corners.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Dagger Sheath
description: Brass trimmed sheath.
credit_line: Purchased from W. O. Oldman, 1911

title: Snuff Box
description: Silver snuff box.  Cylindrical with a cover attached by a chain (similar to A1150).
credit_line: Purchased from Alexander Scott, 1914

title: Sweetmeat Dish
description: Locally said to be of "(wild) grape root."  Wide disc base, stepped sides, almost flat rim.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Knife
description: Knife.  Straight single edged iron blade, bevelled to point.  Much worn.  Wide tang inserted in two piece black wood grip.  Metal cap.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Morgan Wing on behalf of the Estate of Florence C. Whitney, 1942

title: Drum
description: Hour glass drum, metal, heads missing. Shell decorated with band designs and ropes of metal. Good condition.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Sarah (William D.) Frishmuth, 1900

title: Amulet
description: Red cloth with red cloth cord. Rectangular with paper inside. Hand stitched.
credit_line: Gift of Rev. Robert J. Bolton, 1985

title: Dagger
description: Dagger.  Nepalese type of handle.
credit_line: Purchased from W. O. Oldman, 1911

title: Drum
description: Small rattle hand drum (na-ch'un or damaru).  Wood.  Painted red.
credit_line: Gift of William Henry Furness 3rd, Alfred Craven Harrison Jr. and Hiram M. Hiller, 1900

title: Pen
description: Pen from traveling writing set.   Simple wooden stylus with chisel-shaped end.  Pen case(51-4-59A) and Brass inkwell(51-4-59C).
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Charm
description: Silver tube with suspension rings.  Relief decoration.  Charm container. Ends of tube rounded.
credit_line: Gift of James K. Gamble Jr., 1970

title: Wine Jug
description: Pewter. Disc base, body with fluted, rounded sides, plain rounded shoulder; onset neck, with encircling incised lines, contracting to high flaring rim. Lid, hinged in center, is fixed to one side of rim; sucking tube from body through this side of lid.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Robert R. Service, 1951

title: Ornament
description: Oblong silver with turquoise in border - red stones at corners. Brass plaque in center with raised threads of design. Rectangular ornament. Back has embossed decoration with zig-zag border design and undecorated center medallion. 2 loops on top for cord. Top has 3 pyramids of tiny balls, bottom has 5. Front face of box has border app. 1 cm wide of small turquoise pieces inlayed in rows of 2. At each corner is glass decoration: two orange, one pinkish and one clear. In center of the face is a raised rectangular piece of metal with embossed decoration.
credit_line: Bequest of Maxwell Sommerville, 1904

title: Bowl
description: Bowl.  Silver with leather sides in mid section.  Copper lining inside foot.
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Winnifred S. Miller, 1997

title: Statuette
description: Tiny bronze image, with separately cast mandorla, of a multi-headed, multi-armed figure, possibly representing the demonic personification of death, Yama. Through the open mandorla can be seen the more tranquil figure of a Buddha.
credit_line: Received from various sources, pre-1992

title: Water Vessel
description: Water vessel.  Of Chinese origin.  Copper ewer in shape of Chinese quadrilateral bronze.
